About Baltimore Scala
We've organized the group to help bring together software engineers and developers from Baltimore city who are interested in the Scala programming language, and other issues related to building high-scalability web sites and applications. The meeting will also focus on the Akka toolkit and the Play framework.

Agenda for Meetups
Each meeting we'll try to find a speaker who can talk about a project or technology they're working on, and we'll discuss projects we can work on as a group. results.description:
Pomeranians on Parade is a group for Pomeranians and the people who love and care for them. We'll take our little bundles of energy on walks in area parks and trails in DC, MD, and VA. We’ll also enjoy other small dog-friendly adventures. If you love meeting people, having fun, and Pomeranians, then this is the group for you. There are many great trails, parks, and activities for us to explore together. We'll also learn interesting facts about the Pomeranian breed and have educational seminars. A part of our mission will be to help homeless Pomeranians (and other dogs) find loving, caring homes through volunteer work and other opportunities when able. This group also participates in some fee-based activities. Each group member is expected to participate in at least two annual major group activities (parades, charity walks, etc.) and attend the monthly outings as often as you are able. 

Join us and begin your adventure today!

results.description:
Sid Hameed 

President and Founder of Brickfront Properties and Construction, LLC, Owner of Expert Real Estate Advisers Group Brokerage, and owner of Real Estate Investment Solution Group. Full Service Real Estate Investment Company

Sid Hameed is a powerful business driver whose entrepreneurial instincts and clarity of vision have carried multiple companies through rapid and continuous growth. With over 24 years of business and real estate experience that includes project management, construction management, rehabbing, and investing. Sid has built and impressive portfolio of projects. At the age of 15, Sid begin working in construction and it was during this time he developed a passion for real estate and has been an unstoppable force ever since.

During the 1990’s, Sid joined Computer World Service Corporation as Vice President of Business Development and was instrumental in growing the company from a small start-up to a multi- million-dollar company in a short time. The company was named by Inc. Magazine as one of the fastest growing small businesses in the U.S. two years in a row. During his venture with the company, he received numerous awards for leadership and business development.

After years of doing real estate part-time with great success, Sid decided that it was time to focus all his attention and efforts exclusively on his life passion. Sid founded Brickfront Properties and Expert Real Estate Advisers Group where he specializes in real estate investments and rehabbing investment properties. His most recent venture is Real Estate Investment Solutions Group, a Washington DC Metro based Real Estate Investment Firm specializing in Mortgage Notes.

For more information, visit http://www.brickfrontproperties.com, call us at (240) 764-5347 or email us at sidhameed@brickfrontproperties.com.

results.description:
Since I bought my first iPad in April 2010, it opened the door to the idea called 'Life Hack', basically imporving productivity in both in your work and life. I tried a local mobile device user support group for over a year and a half. Eventually, I was very frustrated and gave up. I realized that I should create my own ‘life hack for mature women’ system. 

My intention is to share the result of what I learned and am still learning after reading 30+ books and over 1000 blog posts and tried over 300 apps. This is not about ‘multi-tasking’ or mobile device overload. This is about getting more things done while decreasing anxiety and stress Finally this is about being productive at any age while keeping the balance in life with our peers.

Let's me explain what 'iTracking Party ' stands for.

1.  'i'  stands for cloud and to the extent mobile devices.   We will learn how to take advantage of cloud computing and mobile devices.  The nut shell is to be able to access your important 'unique' information wherever you are.

2.  'Tracking', the most important habit we need to creat is to track as much activity as possible.  This is where moble divices become very handy.

3.   'Party';  do you know a single biggest reason why people procasitnate? Isolation !!, Yes, if you are normal human being, it is almost impossible to do it alone.  Making new habits and stopping bad and old habits are so hard  if you do it alone.  However, if you have someone to do it together,  it becomes doable.

This is why I try to make 'local small groups'.  Then within those groups , we can work together.

Let me know if you want to start a new local group.  I will facilitate any group which have more than 2 people.
results.name: iTracking Party

results.description:
From Darkness to Light (FDTL)

We are continuing our women's only (18 to 65) survivor group, From Darkness to Light. This interactive experience is lead by 2 licensed therapists who are Certified Clinical Trauma Professionals. Our 12 week structured skills-based group is tailored towards women who have experienced varying levels of victimization, loss of a loved one, intimate partner violence, rape, sexual assault, or natural disaster. This is an opportunity for women to heal and connect with individuals that have similar experiences. 

Our goal is to provide structured, interactive, and educational materials that help members move from shame, isolation, and learned helplessness to an empowered, strength-based, judgment-free view of self that will help members to facilitate healing, emotional regulation, and coping.

results.description:
A fun and supportive group for moms in the Ellicott City, MD area. This is a group for moms who live in Ellicott City, MD (generally the 21042 and 21043 area codes).  If you are within the above geographical boundaries and would like to join this group, please contact us.  

The MOMS Club® of Ellicott City, MD is a local chapter of the International MOMS (Moms Offering Moms Support) Club. We are a non-profit support group for stay-at-home moms and part-time working moms.  All moms are welcome to join but the majority of our activities take place during the weekday.  

The MOMS Club (MOMS Offering Moms Support) is an international nonprofit organization which provides support to full-time or part-time stay-at-home moms, including moms with home-based businesses. Today there are over 2,000 chapters with more than 100,000 members from across the United States. Our network of moms is here to offer support and understanding to each other through the joys and tasks of motherhood. Our club offers a wonderful opportunity to create lifetime friendships for moms and children alike. Our activities include participation in local service projects, monthly meetings (children are always welcome) and fun-filled activities for moms and children to enjoy together. All activities, outings, parties and projects are organized by volunteer moms and attended by moms and children of all ages. We would be thrilled to hear from you and look forward to meeting you and your family!

Dues are $25 per year. If you are interested please contact us!
results.name: The MOMS Club of Ellicott City

results.description: WHAT IS CIRCLESINGING??? CircleSinging is a community oriented, spontaneous, improvisational singing experience, a little bit like a "drum circle" for singers. We take inspiration from methods developed by Bobby McFerrin and his collaborators. A CircleSong leader will create parts on-­‐the-­‐spot, and lead the group in making beautiful, inspired, goofy, or glorious music. Starting with a basic structure, we can variations.Sing beautiful harmonies gain self-­‐confidence, and delight in what we can create together. This is a "mistake-­‐free" zone, for all levels of singers—we sing for the sheer fun of it! Come sing with us!

Are you interested in trying restaurants, breweries, bars in the DC/Baltimore suburbs? Want someone to go see the latest sci/fi-movie? Even looking for someone to binge-watch geek-worthy TV show? This group is meant for you.

Attendance Policy:

The organizers spend a lot of time planning and coordinate their schedule to attend these events.  When people RSVP and don't show up, it's frustrating, so we have a three-strike and you're out policy.  If you are a "NO SHOW" or change your RSVP within 2 hours of the start of an event more than 3 times you may be removed from the group.  

If you RSVP and are running late, please send a message via Meetup, so we know to expect you.  We understand that life doesn't always go as planned, but try to respect the time and effort of those that are coordinating these activities.

results.description: Join us on our journey to our BEST SELF. Not just a meetup, this is a MOVEMENT. A movement towards a new generation of "whole black women who are EMPOWERED in every area of their lives. Whole women make SMART decisions and know their value. We refer to ourselves as Diamonds and we are priceless! We bring out the BEST in each other! We plan events that cater to EVERY aspect of your life. We workout together, travel together, save and invest together, pray together, solve problems together. We encourage and RESPECT our sisters at all times This group will strengthen your finances, your relationships, your health and emotional well-being and your spirit. We don't plan events, we create experiences. Designed to help you grow, explore the unique and live OUTSIDE "the box". Deep, introspective and amazing!...Not for EVERYONE...only women who want to be wiser, stronger, smarter...who are bold enough to SAY...I WANT MORE. More money, more respect, more love, more self-worth, more adventures, more of ME! My best self. When you bring your best self to every situation, you have the confidence to demand MORE. We limit our group numbers and focus on growth from the INSIDE out. We want active, committed members who ADD to the warm loving supportive atmosphere that we create at our events. We will be leaving meetup soon and expanding. Going National, as we will be featured in a book that we expect to be a National best seller. We have done a documentary and a talk show and our message is clear, BLACK WOMEN WANT MORE...and we will not settle for less than all of the best that life has to offer. If the group is closed, please email me to be added to the waiting list. As inactive and non committed members are removed, new members are added. We hope to MEET you soon... Black Women Who Want more are Spiritually grounded, emotionally stable, physically fit, financially poised, intellectually enlightened, politically conscious, socially gracious, black women who want more, demand more, deserve more of all of the best that life has to offer, on our journey to our best self.....

results.description:
This is an open place for inner world exploration through meditation, silent walk, observing, connecting with Nature Spirit, animal spirit, integration of meditation with walking in nature. We human beings invented the compass in the physical world, but lost the one originally created in each being through unconsciously disconnecting to the Source, as a result losing balance in our daily life, becoming a super doing, wrestling with everything. This is your time to reconnect and call upon the Spirit in you to guide you! 

This Walking Meditation Initiative is part of the Green Earth Life State proposed by Helen Zhu and her Twin brother, guide H.X. New Wisdom (co-authored '2 in 1 in 2 the Supreme Revelation' book series) in their teaching and facilitating for the mass soul awakening process.  For more of their teachings, visit http://learnwithuniversalmind.com/nenl-walking-meditation/

Once on a group hiking, I was quietly walking by another member, we started chatting a bit. She expressed her concern that she might be thought by others that she was not fitting in the society/group; and I noticed many times people were busy talking, networking when in group hiking, all the rich beauty of nature just had been missed...  Do you know who you really are? Are you afraid of being judged by others?

Meditation is set for reaching the state of mind in stillness and quietness, and is the Supreme Tool to connect with the Divine, therefore our gatherings are not aiming at networking, however a stronger bound and connection within the energy world between members will be one of the outcomes of the gathered events through heart to heart connections. 

There are three categories of events

- Silent Walk in nature                    (Saturday/Sunday,  all are welcome)     

- Guided Walking Meditation             (Wednesdays/Fridays)

- Silent Retreat for inner world exploration - includes sessions of meditation, nature observation, inner world journeys, workshops  etc.          (weekends in  winter time)


SILENCE is a requirement in our walking meditation events; when you become more comfortable with silence, you will naturally be ready to start to meditate.  And through practice, you will be able to enter meditative state easily, and go into deep meditation in later state.  Please always keep a pen and small note pad paper for necessary communication in these events. 

Guided Walking Meditations once a month, are always set on Wednesday or Friday mornings to make sure the meditation environment is quiet. It is also a refreshment in your busy daily routines.  You do not 'have to' do anything in your life.  Change starts from within! 


Meditation is not a skill or technique, but a state of mind, there are no levels or forms to burden you, all we need is an open heart and open mind. All are Welcome!


=======Silence === Open Heart === Humble Heart === Awakened Soul ========


Special note: we need event hosts in different locations in this local networking, we also need local event hosts in different geographical locations around the world. Please visit http://learnwithuniversalmind.com/ for the teaching messages, and apply if you feel the calls and fit in the local event host roles.
results.name: New Earth New Life Walking Meditation -DC/MD/VA/East Coast

results.description:
This is my attempt to form a Body Dysmorphic Disorder (BDD) meetup group in Baltimore. It is difficult to find a group of this nature (the closest one I found is located in Ontario, Canada). I'm not great at organizing things, but I have BDD and I think it would be therapeutic to have some sort of discussion with people who also suffer from this.


Thanks     -Sean
results.name: Baltimore Body Dysmorphic Disorder Meetup

results.description: This is a women's only group....men need not apply;).  Women over 40 near Middle River and White Marsh that enjoy life and love to laugh. I am a Pa born, now Marylander ... Lived here a long time and find it's a tough area to meet people if you were not born here. I love football, animals, dinner, wine, pot lucks, reading,travel, hiking, just about anything... Most importantly, sincere women that care about each other and can support each other during times of need. Fun times are easy... But we know, life happens and sometimes you just need a friend... Other than your significant other or husband. This is my first club...and I was informed by some of the girls that I should add a no show policy...my rookie mistake;). I know plans change and lives are busy There is usually a waiting list for these functions so please be courteous to the other women and the restaurant/venue by updating meet up or texting me. I don't want to be a meanie... But I will establish the three strikes you are out rule. It is for the respect of everyone and no one is too busy for an update message or text. Thanks, Cindy
results.name: Women Over 40 Middle River/White Marsh

Taste Art is a Meetup for true food aficionados, chocolate lovers, and art lovers. If you are interested in enhancing your culinary skills and taste palates this group is for you. results.description:
THIS IS A ROLL CALL for heterosexual men who are sick of folks asking them when are they going to get married and have kids!!! The purpose of this group is to find Young at Heart, Single, Black, Working, Men without Kids 40 years and older in the DC, MD, and VA area to connect with each other and other groups of people. This non co-ed group is as private as Meetup.com will allow it to be.

[PLEASE READ ALL BEFORE CLICKING JOIN-Best read from desktop site-plus videos] Just because the men in the group currently do not have kids, it doesn’t mean the men in the group will not have wives and kids in the future. Just as, some may not want them in the future. If you’ve read this far and still have a smile on your face; hopefully, you fit all attributes and this group is for you.

Type of Events:

The group is designed so a person can find one person to roll with or grab the fellas. It’s the perfect group for someone new in town looking to make new friends who have lived in the area for a while. The type of events this group does are completely up to the male members whether that be:

• Sporting , golfing, and fishing events

• Networking, men’s fellowship, and dating and relationship discussions

• Career specific, tech, empowerment, wellness, health,  and fitness conferences

• Night life, themed night out,  single events, and live music events

• Happy hour, wine, dining out and poetry events

• Road dog for annual events, workout partners,  and mentors/mentees collaborations 

• Travel, volunteer work, and home improvement projects,

• Supporting an event, creating a team, or Whatever.   

It’s your group so you decided if want to stay in and play spades or even put on a suit and crash a party with the fellas. The goal is for trustworthy people with different personalities to come together and have fun times.

• • • • • • • 

Preference for the Men's Childfree Group:

• Never married biologically born males who have never had kids

• Ages 40-50 years young but all ages 38 and over are free to join.

• Divorced folks won't be turned away- just make sure the IRS thinks you're single (and God knows you are single)

• Dues Payer After the 1st 6 months $5/yr

“No kids” means no child has ever crawled around with your passed down DNA or you have never knowingly impregnated anyone in the last 10 months. It doesn’t mean the kids don’t live with you. If you click the join button, then go out and get married or impregnate somebody, you no longer fit the attributes of people in the group but the bonds you made in the group should continue in or out of the meetup. This group gives members a platform without judgment because your peers have similar stories.

Don’t Feel You Fit in this Group: <br> If you do not fit all of the listed attributes above, there are many meetups to join that don’t put you in a box so they may suit your needs better. Or, you might want to consider creating your own meetup group. However, this group will have some events inclusive to all as Society isn’t made up of the same types of people. And before you exit this page, think about one 40yr old single black male with no kids to pass on the  group URL link to. We all know at least one. 

Assistant Organizers:  If you don’t know by now, the organizer of this group is biologically a woman and will be the only known woman in the group. The organizer is looking for Male Assistant Organizers to help run the group because the organizer does not plan to create events for the group without a male event host. The only time you will probably see the organizer is when a male event host plans something with other groups.

Social Media/Articles/ Videos: 

You won’t hear from the female organizer that much but when you do she  may brighten your day by sending you information that speaks to your platform like medical ailments :-) or blogger post and youtube videos like theses to get your opinion:

• Article: ""21 Things Black Men Don't Hear Enough" http://blavity.com/21-things-black-men-need-hear/?utm_campaign=coschedule&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=Blavity&utm_content=21+Things+Black+Men+Don%27t+Hear+Often+Enough

• Article: "Childfree Men: Misunderstood and Often Maligned" http://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/complete-without-kids/201203/childfree-men-misunderstood-and-often-maligned

• Blogger’s post about Single Black Men Without Kidshttp://shakaama.blogspot.com/2012/08/black-single-men-with-no-kids-truth.html

• Article on statistics and society’s views of Men vs Women without Children  http://www.blisstree.com/2013/04/03/mental-health-well-being/mental-health/depression/childless-men-more-depressed-than-women-without-kids/

• YouTube: A Single Black Male with no children’s perspective on society’s views on finding out he has no children. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_gR3xROWH9o

•YouTube: Ask a Black Man  “Episode 1: Life of a Single Man https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g2oBXk_RppY (Watch all Episodes)

YouTube:“Qualified, yet Single: Why Good Men Remain Single” https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wv_kwqGXz1g

https://youtu.be/Wv_kwqGXz1g

But never forget, your purpose in this meetup group is to bond with the unmarried guys rather than being a panelist.  Nevertheless, the single men and  no kids group does provide bachelors a platform. If everything you heard/read sounds good to you, Click the Join Button!!!

And for you ladies who have read this with questions, maybe this video will answer one question for you

https://youtu.be/4UkjPjZS1kg


And to the folks that don't understand single without kids over a certain age :
results.name: Black Men: Single Without Kids Working in the DMV ~39yrs+

results.description:
The Film Circle's mission is to offer a casual, weekly forum for people to view and discuss indie, foreign and classic films and meet others who share this interest.

We schedule films weekly in the Baltimore area followed by a meal at a nearby restaurant with lively and informative conversation, encouraging attendees to offer their honest critiques.

Your film, venue and schedule suggestions are welcome and encouraged. Just message one of the organizers. We occasionally host private potluck screenings in organizers' homes.

Once you have joined you can click on the scheduled film title to see our linked excerpts to thought-provoking reviews, and trailers for each film we schedule.  You will also see the other members who are attending and comments they have made. 

In the words of Roger Ebert, "The movies are like a machine that generates empathy.  It lets you understand a little bit more about different hopes, aspirations, dreams and fears. It helps us to identify with the people who are sharing this journey with us." This group's purpose is to bring together people to reflect on filmed artifacts of these journeys.
results.name: Film Circle:  A Community for Film Lovers

results.description: The Hash House Harriers (abbreviated to HHH, H3, or referred to simply as Hashing) is an international group of non-competitive running, social and drinking clubs. An event organized by a club is known as a hash or hash run, with participants calling themselves Hashers.

Join us and let’s grow together a conscious, awakened, and happy community!

results.description:
All are welcome to experience gentle, healing yoga and powerful meditations. This group is aimed at centering and balancing the mind and body. We will focus on dynamic movement that increases flexibility, stimulates the circulatory, immune and endocrine systems, and brings energy down to your core. After doing gentle stretches, poses, and breathing, The balance of the class is dedicated to meditation and relaxation methods. 

The purpose for beginning this group was to help those interested in lowering stress levels, strengthening their body, and mastering their mind. Benefits are physical, emotional and spiritual health and wellness, improved concentration, deeper rest, pain relief, and emotional balance. This group is open to beginners who have never done yoga or meditation, as well as practitioners alike. And you don't have to be extremely flexible. You also do not need a mat. Just wear comfortable clothes that allow you to move freely. 

We meet for free, Sundays at 3:00 p.m.  starting in January.  Meetings are located at 13878 Georgia Avenue in the Northgate Plaza Shopping Center.

We also promote a continued effort to educate ourselves about the ever-evolving universe of Autodesk’s AutoCAD Civil 3D and its supporting programs.  The user group is at its founding stage and is looking for C3D users of all levels who would like to increase their knowledge of the program through activities, both fun and educational, with other users.  We are looking for people who are interested in participating at all levels, from wanting to sit in the corner and listen to being a member of the Board of Directors.  Right now, meetings will be held in Laurel, Maryland, but they can vary based on the planned activity and the membership.  We hope you can join us!

I will likely start by posting events I'm going to, or get invited to every week, so I hope you all will too.

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x48yrSniYBE

"The Harry Potter Alliance turns fans into heroes.

An HPA Chapter uses the power of storytelling to promote important causes in any scale -- locally, globally, or both! We like to call this fan activism. Chapters are like real-life Dumbledore’s Armies (or Fellowships, or Avengers, or Knights of the Round Table -- you know, nerds with a purpose). You will have the power to celebrate your love for fiction and fantasy while also serving your community. We’re changing the world by making activism accessible through the power of story. 

Since 2005, we’ve engaged millions of fans through our work for equality, human rights, and literacy.

OUR VISION
 A creative and collaborative culture that solves the world’s problems.

OUR VALUES
 We believe in magic.
We believe that unironic enthusiasm is a renewable resource.
We know fantasy is not only an escape from our world, but an invitation to go deeper into it.
We celebrate the power of community—both online and off.
We believe that the weapon we have is love.

“We do not need magic to change the world, we carry all the power we need inside ourselves already: we have the power to Imagine Better.” – J.K. Rowling"

Please join me in this Meetup if you're interested in being a leader/member of the HPA Montgomery County Chapter! Don't know if you want to be? Well if you:

* Want to change someone else's life like the Harry Potter books (or whatever other fandom close to your heart) changed yours
* Want to create lasting impact through something deeper than visiting (or simply wanting to but never getting around to it) a soup kitchen
* Want to harness the power behind books and imagination to influence change by letting your creativity loose
* Want to inspire a love of reading in others
* And many, many other things

Then this group is perfect for you! 

I hope you'll join me as we instill the values of Dumbledore's Army within our hearts to embark on many journeys for justice in life!


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KeW8ribDNQU

http://thehpalliance.org/
results.name: Harry Potter Alliance- Montgomery County Chapter

results.description:
Have you had a dream of running your own business with passion & purpose?

Have you ever felt unappreciated, underpaid or even worse not enjoying going to work?

Have you ever felt fearful financially or emotionally when thinking on you need to make a change but feel trapped & don't know how?

Have you ever dreamed of having a better life, full of excitment, purpose, & a knowing that your adding value to the world & getting paid really well for it, making a 6 or 7 digit annual salary doing what you're passionate about?

If you answered yes to any of the above questions then this group is definitely for you!

I decided to start this group because as a coach, seminar leader, and successful entrepreneur I noticed so many people including myself at a point in time struggle financially & emotionally knowing where we work is not who we are.

The purpose of this group is to ignite passion & hope, inspire & support members to create & share there dreams on paper so they know the direction they'd like to go as well as how to proceed.

You'll become aware of the freedom on SO many levels that you can create when you begin to focus your energies on your dream.  You'll have the support from myself & the amazing team of members that want to succeed with you!

Throughout these Meetups I'll be teaching you the processes on how to begin your business without any risk. You'll learn the amazing techniques, tools, and processes to build momentum & desire.

What gives me the right?  I, who at one time was borderline bankrupt, a financial mess, miserable, & hopeless that I'd ever be able to change, am now living a life I once only dreamed of! From building companies from scratch, selling them for hundreds of thousands of dollars, to retiring in my twenties, to becoming a millionaire, & failing more than most people would probably ever admit, I can't wait to share the secrets I've learned over the years.

Are you ready to decide once in for all that you deserve more.  Are you ready to learn & implement these amazing concepts into your life so you too can be on the road to freedom? Aren't you worth it?

Attending this meetup could seriously & possibly be the best decision you've ever made in your life! I'm SO excited to mentor & facilitate sharing amongst each other in this amazing group.

Matthew Croteau

Find out more about Matthew at www.matthewcroteau.com
results.name: Baltimore Aspiring Entrepreneurs

Just beginning the process of creating a Coder Dojo Annapolis. Recruiting parents now with first event to be scheduled in the New Year.


Help kids learn coding skills with a free weekend code club. We're bringing the CoderDojo program of free coding clubs for kids 8-17 to the Annapolis area. Join up if you're a parent who wants to get their kids involved, a coder who would like to help kids learn, or like a number of our members... you're a parent who codes and wants to do both. 

If you're in Virginia, you may also be interested in http://coderdojonova.com/

of If you're in Rockville, you may also be interested in http://coderdojodc.com/

results.description:
This group is focused on collectively creating the life you would like to experience more of. We use Reiki,Prayer,Meditation,Crystals, Intuition and Intention to create magic in our world. In order to experience the joy you seek on the outside you must get clear on what's going on in your inside. This group is a place to receive honest feedback on why your life is not working the way you want it to and how it can be better in the future. Get clear, focused and divinely guided advice from your Spirit Guides and Angels so you can grow. We are metaphysically based and use a variety of spiritual tools to consciously create joy,prosperity and peace. If this sounds like something you would like to be a part of then welcome! All that is required is a open heart, a open mind and honest participation. Grow or go!

Please check out our message board for more inspiration!

results.description:
. We will be meeting up at dining establishments a few times a month. Cocktails will be served first.
-If you do not drink this is still a good time to socialize and meet new people who naturally love food and like things- After fraternizing, we will give you the ability to sample new food at low prices outside the traditional restaurant experience. The supper club is fantastic for networking, getting jobs, contacts and even romance. Whether you’re bringing together friends or looking to make new ones The advantage lies in that you have time to get to know other people and a fun way to meet new people.

results.description:
Sponsored by the DC Public Library, this is a group for people who want to learn how to do things they've wanted to learn how to do. Do you want to... grow your own food? Mend a torn shirt? Bake bread? Unclog a sink? Use a power drill? Think of all those old-school skills that we don't learn anymore... that's what this group is about.
Each month, we'll explore a skill or set of skills that will empower us to take care of ourselves and each other. We will use books from the library, online tools, and learning from members of the community.
Come learn with us!

And check out more library programs at www.dclibrary.org/southeast

We started this group because we would like to meet other individuals that are interested in increasing opportunities in Real Estate investments. We are looking forward to exploring the growing opportunities in Maryland, Delaware, Virginia, Pennsylvania, Washington, DC and surrounding areas with like minded members.

Blumberg ("The Doctor of the Dead"), professor of "Zombies in Popular Media" at the University of Baltimore and co-author of ZOMBIEMANIA, for a fun gathering of the undead horde! Zombie movies, TV, comics, books, games, and much more - it's all apocalypse all the time! Hopefully we can build an ongoing horror and zombie fan community in good ol' Baltimore and see where it goes from there!
results.name: The Doctor of the Dead's Zombiemania Apoca-Meetup!

results.description: This group will provide our community with an array of excellent opportunities to grow, expand the mind/body consciousness, and to heal in a creative and supportive environment. Multiple times per month, we will bring various dynamic group leaders and teachers to provide curriculum that includes practical spirituality, meditation, body movement, reiki, tai chi, Nia Technique, principles of Shamanism, and endless diverse topics. In addition this group will offer CE's for Massage Therapists providing ethics, diversity, bodywork techniques, and multiple continuing education courses. The intention of the group is to encourage the community to connect and support each other in creating peace and balance within the heart and mind.

We love a good concert and love to take our kids, but unfortunately there just isn't anything like this in annapolis. Come check out music and a Lego play-time the first Saturday of every month.

OneCircle also schedule house concerts with musical groups, drum circles, workshops on the Dances of Universal Peace, healing and other events. OneCircle is centered around a monthly interactive universal workshop service.

results.description: This is a Futsal group that will meet up for pick-up Futsal at the brand new Odenton Sports Center (8266 Lokus rd. Odenton, MD). Futsal is a fast indoor soccer game played on a court with a smaller ball that promotes more creativity and technical ability. Though pick-up cost is $5, this meetup group will serve as a means for those who have an interest in learning and playing more futsal to meet and create a group in a local community. Flat are required as this is a brand new Taraflex hard court that is easy on the knees. Days will vary from later weekday nights to various weekend times. Anyone may attempt to coordinate a game and a court can even be reserved for free if there are enough players from the group. Hope to see you on the court!
results.name: Odenton Futsal Meetup

Vitae Aeternus - A Camarilla Vampire LARP

results.description: This group is for women that want what God has for them in a mate and refuse to settle for anything less than His best for them! In this group we will have bible study, attend workshops and engage in social outings such as dining out at least once every 4- 6 weeks. Our focus will be understanding our "Season of Singleness" and its importance, and becoming the Proverbs 31 Woman. We are simply about empowering women with tools to help them maintain a life pleasing to God while in their singleness! "Charm is deceitful and beauty is passing, but a woman who fears the Lord, she shall be praised". Proverbs 31:30 - NKJV
results.name: Waiting For Boaz: DMV Single Christian Women Meetup

results.description: This group is for anyone who is interested in meeting other singles throughout DC, Maryland, and Virginia. There will be speed dating, social mixers, and other events to bring singles together for fun, new friends, dating, and networking!
results.name: DMV Singles in the City

results.description: We're dedicated to bringing the MMA community together and expanding its size within Maryland. For that purpose, our focus will be on creating events that allow members to meet, learn from each other and advance our martial arts. There will be seminars, open mats, gym invites, and other local events. Also feel free to use this forum to discuss the art and share knowledge. The group is open to all, even if you've never trained before. We can introduce you to what makes MMA awesome.
results.name: Maryland Mixed Martial Arts Network

results.description: This group is for African Americans who are 40+, live in the Baltimore/Washington area, and love to travel. Planned trips will be extended weekend getaways. Hotels selected will typically be 4 to 5 star hotels and flights selected will be through BWI airport. Members are free to make travel arrangements through any travel agency or online travel service of their choice. Trips for 2016 and 2017 include Honolulu; Las Vegas; New York City; Houston; Paradise Island, Bahamas; Punta Cana, Dominican Republic; and Toronto, Ontario.   Past trips include South Beach and Atlanta.  All members must have a personal photo on their profile so everyone can put a face to a name.
results.name: 40+ Black Travel

results.description: Maryland Social Group does everything from a Happy Hour to a helping hand for when you move. This group was created for the same reason Meetup was created – to build a sense of community. With the DC area being such a transient community and as a transplant myself, I’ve gone through the cycle of making good friends only to see them move to another city several times. The group is diverse and our ages range from 21 to 60. Our community is open to everyone, but most people reside along or near the Route 1 corridor (aka Baltimore Avenue or Washington Blvd) in Maryland (Ellicott City, Columbia, Elkridge*, Burtonsville, Beltsville, Catonsville, Laurel, Jessup, Maryland City, Hyattsville, Greenbelt, Bowie, College Park, Silver Spring). Our community includes single, married, and those with families. We do a variety of activities (HH, shopping, Guys or Girls’ Night Out, pet sitting, play dates for kids, traveling, game nights, book club, ride to airport, etc.) As always, you should be cautious and meet in public first. Everyone will need to post a photo. If three members complain, you will be removed from the group. The bottom line is if you are young at heart, active, and looking for friends or to expand your circle of friends, you have found the right place.
results.name: Maryland Social Group

topics.name: How to Pass the CPA Exam

results.description: We will meet regularly to prepare to pass the CPA exam.
results.name: Baltimore  CPA Exam Study Meetup

results.description:
Get out and have fun! This is the fun group that you want to be in! We're a group of outgoing, down to earth, adventurous professionals who live in Anne Arundel County and want to make new friends while exploring the area. Members range in age from mid 20's-late 30's. This group is meant to meet people and create long lasting friendships so this group will NOT be a big one with hundreds of members. It's about quality not quantity.

Together, we'll enjoy a variety of activities including music, arts, nightlife, dinners, happy hours, festivals, concerts, sporting events, fitness, local hikes, movies, game nights, trivia nights, cooking and potluck parties, wine & beer tastings/tours, occasional day trips and travel, etc.

You have a lot of choices when it comes to meetup groups, but if you want a friendly, welcoming group that fosters real friendships, this is it! The purpose of this group is to make new friends and have a good time. If that sounds like something you would enjoy, please join us! 

Member Rules:

1) To be considered for membership, your profile MUST include an ACTUAL PHOTO of yourself so we can recognize you at events.

2) If you act rude or are disrespectful to members in the group, you will be removed from the group! You have to treat members with R-E-S-P-E-C-T! :)

3) If you are a continous no show to events or you habitually cancel at the last minute, you will be removed from the group.
results.name: Fun Social Professionals

results.description:
Meetup for anyone curious about hypnosis/hypnotherapy and how to accomplish goals using Hypnosis. 

During our meetings we will discuss topics relating to hypnosis, such as change work, using the subconscious minds for success, self-hypnosis, the history of hypnosis, stress relief, weight reduction, and smoking cessation, anxiety, fears, etc.

Most of the meetings will be held at my downtown Columbia, MD off just across the street from The Mall in Columbia. 

While mostly a discussion group, it will also contain experiential elements and demonstrations, sessions (sometimes for a nominal/low cost).  Sometimes we will conduct GROUP HYPNOSIS sessions, which will include a fee. 

We may bring in guest speakers and ask other local hypnotists/hypnotherapists to visit and speak. 

Note that the Meetup service is a social media site, and your RSVP becomes public to this list and other potential attendees. If you would like to speak or share a topic request for an upcoming meeting, please contact Racquel A. Knight at (443) 686-9645.
results.name: Hypnosis Columbia Meetup

results.description: The Columbia-Area Linux Users Group (CALUG) is a friendly informal group of Columbia-area residents and workers who share an interest in Free and Open Source Software (FOSS) in general, and Linux in particular. The CALUG meets at 7:00PM on the second Wednesday of each month at the Fulton offices of OmniTI. Like the software that interests us, our meetings are free - and open to everyone.
results.name: Columbia Area Linux Users Group

results.description:
*** BESS is an established social group with most of our events averaging 10-40 people. You can find tons more information at http://www.bess-md.org/ and via our presence on FetLife ***

BESS is an educational and social group for consenting adults with shared interests in BDSM. These interests include, among others, Dominance & submission, bondage & discipline, leathersex, fetishism, cross dressing, and roleplay. 

BESS is multi-sexual. All genders and orientations are welcome to attend. 

Our goal is to provide a safe, friendly, and discreet environment for the education and encouragement of adults interested in Safe, Sane, and Consensual expressions of BDSM.

BESS Contributorships, Educational Meetings, Socials, and SIGs are open to anyone, age 19 or older, with a sincere interest in some aspect of BDSM. BESS is a not-for-profit 501(c)7 organization. We are NOT a sex or swingers club. We are NOT a dating service. We do NOT make referrals.

results.description: We are advocates for healthy hair and we are in constant pursuit to educate women on the importance of adopting a healthy hair care regimen for natural and relaxed hair. We will provide support on your hair journey by way of offering hair care tips and offering advice to those that may be experiencing damaged tresses, thinning hair or hair loss. We will be offering informational seminars, hands-on training seminars and local events for a fee. We are here to help you become more educated so that you can make the right decisions for your hair. We will arrange interactive meetings throughout the DMV area. This group is operated by a license Cosmetologist/Hair Transformation Specialist/Educator and we have assembled a team of professionals who are highly skilled, committed and believe in our mission that will speak on various topics. This group is for women that are searching for a beauty professional to aid them on a successful hair care journey for a positive change. This group is for beauty professionals that are interested in the movement. And for those that is interested in becoming a part of the hair industry and would like to be trained by us. Feel free to visit our web site: www.sonyamichellehairspa.com
results.name: Saving Our Strands (S.O.S.) ™ Hair Movement (DMV)

results.description: The Annapolis Morning Song Circle (AM Song Circle), directed by vocalist Elizabeth Melvin, invites new and experienced singers to come together for the pure joy of making beautiful vocal music together. No audition is required, and no music-reading experience necessary. The repertoire is eclectic and fun, drawing from world, folk, gospel and traditional music. You will be amazed at how quickly you'll be immersed in the thrill of singing in three- and four-part harmony.
results.name: Annapolis Morning Song Circle

results.description: This group is for the "young at heart" interested in traveling near and far with a group of like minded travel enthusiasts. We will have various planning meetings throughout the year to create our travel bucket list, which could include cruises and tours. This group is open to all who enjoy traveling and making new friends along the way.

results.description:
Welcome to a group for all ages, multicultural and diverse! We love to have fun, learn and share in ideas. Everyone is welcome as long as you're nice, open minded and want to get out more! In this group, there are no strangers just friends who haven't met yet.

Our activities will include affordable galleries/museums, shows, and fun dance classes.

I'd really like for us to explore DC, Maryland and Virginia metro areas.

Please try to be  as active and sociable as possible. You never know who your next friend might be.

Feel free to make suggestions at our meet and greets or send me a message!

This is a group for anyone interested in crochet, knitting, tatting, sewing, or general crafting. We'll start off with a monthly "Stitch and Bitch" for us to get together and work on their current projects, get advice, inspire and share resources. As the group grows we'll include other types of crafting events. If you have a craft that you'd like to share or teach, suggest a meetup date/time/location and it will become an event once three people sign up.

Show off your work in our Finished Projects photo album.

results.description: This meetup group, coordinated through the Office of Cyber Development at the MD Department of Business & Economic Development, is designed to bring professionals from Maryland's cybersecurity and technology community together in an INFORMAL environment for SOCIALIZING and NETWORKING. Never an agenda. No fee to join/attend. Simply pay for whatever you order to eat and drink at the venue during the meetups.  Meetups will be hosted at varying locations throughout the state. They're all about mixing and mingling and getting to know who's who in Maryland's cybersecurity and technology eco-system. Join us for the fun. Feel free to invite others to attend. You never know who you'll meet and the business opportunities that may present themselves!

results.description: This group is for same sex couples having one Asian partner and who want to get together for social, entertainment, and other events around Maryland. We are not for singles.

results.description:
Our primary focus is to visit and experience the beauty of the United States East Coast, right here in our own back yard from Canada to Florida.  But, don't be surprised if we venture to other locals as well!!   It's all up to what interests' you!

In the mean time... There will be lots of other events and activities posted to share and do!  We can meetup at various local venues, get to know one another and share fun times and travel ideas.

Keep checking back often to see what we have in store and remember it is important to PARTICIPATE!!  :)
results.name: Baltimore East Coast Travel & Events Meetup

results.description:
This group is for anyone looking to meet new people and make new friends. From dinner out to live concerts to charity events, we are open to a variety of activities. If you are looking for a more relaxed group that is not about the party scene or big trips, this is the group for you! We look forward to meeting you!

Have you recently moved to Howard? Or maybe not so recently?
Are you in need of some social interaction?
Do you like food, booze, movies, concerts, sports, festivals etc...?
Do you care about buying local, recycling, and giving back to the community?
Well then please join my group. I created this group because moving to a new city and meeting like-minded people is hard, especially when you are not in school and work for a small business like I do, with only 3 other employees...

This group is best suited for open-minded people, who are a little snobby about their food (no trips to Applebee's) like to enjoy a good cocktail, feel comfortable at a gallery opening or a baseball game and like to have good conversations...
This group is open to all races, genders, sexual orientations, religions, political parties etc...
Only requirement, must be 21+

Whether you are straight off the boat or have lived here your whole life the goal is to experience new things and meet new people.

results.description:
Decrease your stress and increase your vitality! Improve your balance, health, body awareness and discover a new way to transform the quality of your life through movement. The movements are slow and gentle and have a profound impact on the whole person - body, mind, and spirit. Classes are open to all adults and all fitness levels, no prior experience is necessary.

There are several local Feldenkrais instructors in this group (look for the co-organizers).  Please feel free to be in touch with us with any questions about Feldenkrais Method.  In addition to the events on this group's calendar, most of us offer private Functional Integration and/or Awareness Through Movement sessions, so please be in touch if you are interested!

results.description:
Place for Baltimore area folks to share ideas and activities related to the mission of the Institute of Noetic Sciences. We are interested in the mysteries and the extraordinary potential of consciousness.

If you would like to join the group, please send an email to Jane, janenankelly@msn.com explaining your interest. We require this to prevent spammers from spoiling the experience for our members.

More information may be found at www.baltimoreions.org and 

https://www.facebook.com/groups/BaltimoreIONS/

Join us for vibrant discussions every month and an engaging book club every other month. The times and dates of the meetings are generally:

Discussion Group: 7:00-8:30 pm, 2nd Tuesday of the month

Book Club: 7:00–8:30 pm, 3rd Tuesday of every OTHER month

Meetings are held at the Center for Spiritual Living, 362 Main Street, Reisterstown, MD, 21136.  There is plenty of free parking in the lot at the back of the building.  Our group hosts an annual gathering and occasional field trips, as well.

We say “Friends of IONS” because our group follows the work of the nationally based Institute of Noetic Sciences (www.Noetic.org) founded by astronaut Edgar Mitchell. Please visit their website to learn more.

The mission of the national organization is:
“Broadening our knowledge of the nature and potentials of mind and consciousness and applying that knowledge to enhancing human well-being and the quality of life on the planet.”

Given the wide range of topics and opinions that are presented and discussed during our activities, it may not surprise you that IONS notes that “Views expressed by speakers, workshop leaders and participants do not necessarily reflect the views of IONS or anyone associated with The Institute of Noetic Sciences” which, in other words, means that we foster diverse and open-minded conversations, enough that someone is bound to take an opposing view or even not like what is said!

And, unfortunately, in a litigious society, we also must share that Baltimore Friends of IONS is wholly independent of the Institute of Noetic Sciences and is legally and financially responsible for its own activities.

Enough said, now please enjoy the rest of our site and take part in our activities.
results.name: Baltimore Friends of IONS

results.description:
We are a group that discusses questions in the Socratic way of examining the question for built-in assumptions. We meet to learn from each other's perspectives. 

Socrates Cafe is a nationwide movement to bring philosophical discussion out of academia and to the general public.

results.description:
“Il bel far niente means 'the beauty of doing nothing'... [it] has always been a cherished Italian ideal. The beauty of doing nothing is the goal of all your work, the final accomplishment for which you are most highly congratulated. The more exquisitely and delightfully you can do nothing, the higher your life's achievement. You don't necessarily need to be rich in order to experience this, either.”~ Elizabeth Gilbert, Eat, Pray, Love 

This group is for anyone interested in having fun and meeting awesome peeps to travel through this life with. If you are interested in eating, praying, loving, dancing, traveling, talking circles, hiking, biking, road trips, watching trees grow and other fun activities come join me on this awesome ride called LIFE. Together we will ENABLE ourselves and others to accomplish the goal of embodying 'Il bel far niente' ....and we'll have fun doing it.


“The mystery of life isn't a problem to solve, but a reality to experience.” ― Frank Herbert, Dune

results.description: Vets Journey Home is an organization dedicated to helping Veterans with emotional issues from time in military service. Vets Journey Home focuses on PTS, MST (Military Sexual Trauma), emotional guilt and trauma many Veterans carry with them long after their time in service. These are feelings that are hard to release to family and friends who have not experienced them. Vets Journey Home is committed to giving Veterans the Welcome Home they deserved and helping them heal their hearts and bring peace to their souls.

Mostly we want to write better, so we share readings, including our own writing, and we work on our skills using guidelines and exercises from writing manuals.

Everyone who wants to build their Buyer's List, expand their contacts, and increase their business. NO seminars, webinars, guest speakers, systems, DVD's, or anything else will be sold here. Just meet and greet like minded individuals. Share deals, and close deals.

results.description:
This group is for Women in Business who are looking for a way to grow both professionally and personally. We support each other and are building a network that gives guidance, support, and resources to our sister business owners.   We will attend events together, hold monthly Meet and Greet events, attend our sister group member events, provide educational opportunities as well as social activities that build relationships.  Several times a year we will partner with Non-profit organizations and others that support women on a variety of levels; this includes opportunities to volunteer. As such we are also looking for ways to encourage young girls to become entrepreneurs.  If this sounds like something you want to be a part of then you are welcome to join us.  

If you do, you will be asked to attend a minimum of 6 events per year and volunteer with us at least once a year.  This is the only way to build a solid network and true friendships.  Those that continually RSVP to MeetUps and do not attend will be deleted from the group.  Those that join our Meetup group but do not attend within 2 months of joining will be deleted.  There is no fee for membership, however, some Meetups may require payment.  As out group grows so does the fee for hosting the Meetup group so we may from time to time limit the members to keep cost down and open up membership as needed.

Please note that many members of this Meetup may be in Direct Sells.  There is no recruiting allowed! Should this possibly change you will be notified.  This is banned to make sure members are not feeling pressured to join organizations are constantly being bombarded with products and recruiting promotions.   If someone is interested in joining your organization please meet with them outside of our activities.  

Have an upcoming event or promotion and you want us to support it, please message me and request I post it on our calendar.  However, you must be an ACTIVE member to get this perk.. Active is defined as attending the minimum amount of events and volunteering.

Questions? Message me!  I look forward to meeting each of you and making new business connections.

results.description:
What is Couchbase?

Couchbase is the company behind Couchbase open source project, a vibrant community of developers and users of Couchbase document-oriented database technology. 

Couchbase Server is a packaged version of Couchbase technology that’s available in Community and Enterprise Editions. Couchbase is known for easy scalability, consistent high performance, 24x365 availability, and a flexible data model. 

Companies like AOL, Cisco, Concur, LinkedIn, Orbitz, Salesforce.com, Shuffle Master, Zynga and hundreds of others around the world use Couchbase Server for their interactive web and mobile applications.

Sign up to our Couchbase Developer Newsletter
results.name: Couchbase MD, VA, DC

results.description:
Non-Profit Leaders,

This group is designed to give you a forum to attend free or low-cost workshops, network with other leaders and enjoy interesting social events. Why did I create this group? I enjoy working with non-profit organizations, helping them to create avenues for funding. We will have some joint events with our sister Meetup group, Baltimore Professionals and Entrepreneurs. This group was formerly Baltimore Business Leaders. I look forward to meeting you. -Will Holmes<br>www.whcusa.com
results.name: Baltimore Non-Profit Leaders

results.description:
Welcome to Free State Craft Beer Enthusiasts! 

This is a group for people in the Maryland area who appreciate craft beer.  Our members come from many parts of the U.S., and call numerous Maryland cities and towns “home” now – and there are even a few of us who were born and raised here.  Member experience ranges from just becoming familiar with the craft beer scene to longtime homebrewing.  All levels of experience are welcome!

We’re nonjudgmental about the styles and brands our members like, because people’s tastes differ.  My mantra has always been that you should drink what you like, but try a different style occasionally, because your tastes might change.  That’s part of the experience - trying different styles and expanding your knowledge of craft beer. 

We have meetups in many different locations in Maryland.  I tend to call them - be they happy hour, brewery tour, or beer festival - in the Crofton, Gambrills, Annapolis, Columbia, and Baltimore areas.  But we’ve recently looked farther away for meetup locations, in places such as Frederick and Southern Maryland.  We may even call a few meetups in DC and Virginia, too, depending on member response.  I’m always looking for new breweries, brewpubs, and beer bars to add to our list, so please don’t be shy about letting me know what your favorite beer bar or brewery is, or maybe one to which you’ve never been but would like to visit.

We have our regular meetup at Frisco Tap House - the group’s sponsor - in Gambrills (Crofton), on the last Wednesday of each month.  I’ve recently considered moving the day of the week to Tuesday, to coincide with Frisco’s weekly Pint Night, and may be making that change shortly.  If you’ve never been, I urge you to attend one of these monthly meetups, or visit it yourself: http://www.friscotaphouse.com/.

I hope that, with your participation, we can make this a fun and educational group.  Again, welcome!

About me:  I’ve been an avid homebrewer for a long time, and beer and travel related to it are my passions.  I hope to attend both the Great American and Great British beer festivals one day.

I’m pretty knowledgeable about processes, styles, and brands.  I’ve always favored British- and Belgian-style ales, but recently discovered that I love American black IPAs.  This came as a surprise to me, because I don’t tend to like “regular” American IPAs.  (Again, tastes change.) 

Sláinte!
results.name: Free State Craft Beer Enthusiasts

For more Info- amsalsadance@gmail.com

Like Us on Facebook
http://www.facebook.com/amsalsadance
Follow us on Instagram @ am_salsa_dance

We invite speakers to our weekly meetings who enable us to learn more about the community where we live and about ways we can be of service.

results.description: The Bowie-Crofton Camera Club has been serving photography enthusiast for over thirty years. In addition to Bowie and Crofton, our members come from a large geographical area that covers much of central and southern Maryland. The membership of B-CCC demonstrates a wide range of skill levels, interests and experiences. Each year's schedule features guests who cover topics that are educational and entertaining for everyone from the newest, most novice photographer on up to the seasoned professional. Our members range from beginners to highly skilled photographers. Our interests are digital imaging, black & white prints, color prints, and digital 'slide' shows, with many devotees in each division. You will find this an active club - we do things. We meet four Monday evenings each month, September through May, for competitions, lectures, demonstrations and discussions. We conduct workshops, go on fun-filled field trips and publish an informative, award-winning newsletter.

The purpose of this group is to support the growth of the Baltimore console fighting game community. Gamers of all levels, backgrounds, and various competitive videogames are most welcome.

results.description:
We are a group of 20's-early 40's that enjoy to get together for trivia, happy hour, live music, good food and an occasional bar crawl.  Also we have a long list of out door activities including corn hole, bbq, hiking, camping, canoeing, running.

We have a good base of friends in the Annapolis area and are always open to meeting new members, so feel free to come out and meet everyone.  Suggestions for events are also encouraged.

This group is open to anyone, for that reason we will need to have a personal conduct policy.  Please  respect your fellow meetup members.  In past groups it has been a rare occurrence that this would need to be implemented.  If anyone has an issue with another member please bring it to the attention of any organizer.  As organizers of this group we promise to keep all communications private.  In the event of an issue, the member will be informed and if repeated incidents occur they will be removed from the group.

New to the city??? Looking to network and connect with professionals??? 

Well, look no further. Experiences our exclusive networking events and meet professionals from all walks of life. Join us for socializing and networking and meet new friends. Our group is focused on connecting working professionals in DMV area. It's a chance to meet new friends, network with professionals, and explore new opportunities while being part of a great social group.

Members of our group are friendly and approachable. NO MORE seeing and doing things alone. When you attend one of our events, you'll be greeted with a smile and we will introduce you to like minded members.

topics.name: Dining Out, BBQs, Food Fairs, Happy Hour and More

results.description: This is for all of us who live, work, and/or play in Wheaton, MD. Let's get together, meet new people, and make some friends, all while having fun dining out, grabbing drinks, or whatever other social activities strike our fancy. At our core will be dining and happy hours. There are lots of fantastic food options right outside our front doors. Apparently there are over 126 food establishments in Wheaton, which gives plenty of options to get out and explore, even after dropping the various fast food joints or the mall food court. I know there are several on my list that I haven't tried yet but want too, and others that I enjoy but just don't get out and frequent enough. Then we'll see what else we want to do. Probably things like getting a group together to head to the TGIF Summer Concert Series and Taste of Wheaton events, having a cookout in Sligo Creek Park or a member's backyard, or ordering takeout or delivery for a game night or to watch a game. All while keeping it local and supporting our neighborhood establishments.
results.name: Wheaton Eatin' & Social Club

results.description: The Severna Park Taphouse hosts open Mic Nights and Live Music on a regular basis and this meet up was set up to bring together local talent and music lovers. Check out our website for more information and directions www.severnaparktaphouse.com.
results.name: Severna Park Live Music/Open Mic Meetup

results.description: The Central Maryland Smart Talks Meetup is devoted to spreading ideas and sharing knowledge through short, powerful tech-driven talks (1 hour). We welcome people from across various disciplines and seek to create a culture of like-minded collaboration. Our Smart Talks will be held monthly and will feature free knowledge from some of the world's most inspired thinkers. The goal is to create a community of curious thinkers to engage with each other.  To further facilitate collaboration, each Smart Talk will feature a 1 hour mixer after the speaking session.
results.name: Central Maryland Smart Talks Meetup

Home Buying Process Step by Step

topics.name: Learn How To Buy & Sell Mortgage Notes

results.description: This group is for anyone who is interested in learning more about Mortgage Notes. If you are a novice or if you are an expert, you should not only join this online forum, but we would love to have you attend our in-person meetings. We started this group so we can begin discussions and networking, with like-minded individuals, surrounding the distressed asset industry. So, if you have any interest in Distressed Assets, in the form of Mortgage Notes, come out and network with us!!

results.description: It's classy, sophisticated and comes with an air of power. Yes, there is nothing like a really good glass of whiskey. This group is about bringing people together all walks-of-life and professions over one common interest - a really good glass of whiskey. And as most people know, some of the best business connections are made over a drink. Don't think you "like" whiskey straight-up? Think again. It is all about developing your pallet, and trying different ones, to find which you like the best. Let me tell you, the flavors are complex and amazing once you start to appreciate the art of it. So, if you are looking to find "your drink," a newbie or pro, simply a whiskey-lover, or generally appreciate alcohol and its history, then join the Annapolis Whiskey Lovers Meetup.
results.name: Annapolis Whiskey Lovers Meetup

results.description:
Peteress Piper of Spades here... Calling out all spade/card playing/board gamers a like.  This group is for adult like-minded card playing enthusiasts looking for cheap fun, good times and thrills without the effort of putting out too much pressure to enjoy one's self on a weekend night.

So to all my Nil playing/ Joker, joker, Deuce / Uh,uh ace is the highest spade, card players.... Come join in on the fun!

results.description: This is a group for investors interested in buying and selling Mortgage Notes. The intent is to provide support to each other, answer questions and share experiences. We started this group in order to bring together interested note buyers in our local market, to support and build up like-minded investors to help you find, manage and flip your deals.

results.description: This is a group for all serious and semi-serious writers in Annapolis. Come together to share work, critique and take our writing to the next level!   Short stories, flash fiction, novels, poetry.   We read submissions ahead of time and give critiques and line edits as well as focus on certain aspects of writing at each meeting.  15-minutes each time for free writing or  writing with prompts.  Meets monthly.

results.description: This group is open for anyone who's interested in concerts, film screenings, exhibitions, theatre, lectures, panel discussions, symposia. Let's meet at the Austrian Cultural Forum Washington DC. Everyone is welcome. The events are open to the public and free of charge.
results.name: Austrian Cultural Forum DC Meetup

results.description: This is a group for entrepreneurs and Small Business Owners that want to connect with other experts in the area, collaborate, brainstorm ideas and issues and create business relationships. It’s a simple concept. You know your area of expertise, you know your time, you know your availability, share an hour and recommend a Topic, Time, Place and a brief description of what you could chat about over coffee - and Suggest a Meetup. Anyone in the group that is in need of your expertise and has availability can RSVP with you. You can work out the details after that. All members requesting to join this group must have a website or some online profile/portfolio ahead of being accepted. This is a group for professionals who are looking to make professional connections. It’s also a great group for those of us that don't have a lot of flexibility to network after hours, now you can use that hour that you were going to spend at your favorite cafe anyway, to connect with other professionals. Lets collaborate over coffee.
results.name: Coffee & Strategy MD

results.description: We are an informal group of active investors, traders, and individuals interested in the markets that seek to meet on a regular basis to talk shop, network, and learn from each other over some beers and laughs. We have different skills, experience, and capitalization levels, but we can all learn from each other and have fun while enjoying each others' company. Most of us are members of stocktwits.com (free to join), but it is not a requirement. We are open to everyone! Join us, we'd love to meet you!
results.name: Baltimore Investors & Traders — StockTwits Meetups

results.description:
Join us for a literary happy hour at Columbia's dynamic dining destination, Seasons 52! We will converge on the fourth Wednesday of the month to discuss engaging titles.

Copies of the titles to be discussed each month will be available for pickup at Howard County Library's Central Branch Fiction desk.

results.description: Come find out what's going on in Baltimore City's Parks. . . The Department of Recreation and Parks relies heavily on its friends groups and partners to provide knowledgeable and passionate activities and programs. There is something for everyone.

results.description: This group is for females comfortable in their own skin who know how to have fun and want to meet others similar! You love to dance, adventure in the city, and try new things!
results.name: Girls who just want to have fun
results.who: Girls who want to have fun

results.description: This group is for women over 55 who are interested in meeting new people. After your friends have retired and moved to Florida, here is a way to meet others. Talking, having lunch, discussing books and travels investigating new topics of interest and just getting out and hearing what others have to say. I am hoping you will join and add to the discussions and help me to make the group an interesting one that many others want to join.
results.name: Towson Area Inquisitive Women over 55

results.description: Join us to learn about the latest applicable technology breakthroughs, tried and true techniques, and popular tech applications to help non-profits and government agencies focus reallocate more resources to mission-critical activities instead of peripheral tasks. We'll cover a variety of topics such as how to choose a content management system, hosting services, audio and visual systems, network systems, etc. We'll discuss ways to analyze risk, keep your organization's/staffs'/donors'/constituents' data secure while making your environment interactive. Web design, social-media outreach, SEO, and online marketing may also be an intrinsic part of reaching your goals, so we'll discuss those as well.
results.name: Washington Non-profit and Government technology solutions

results.description:
As a once and future scientist and an explorer, I can tell you it's important to meet, network, and gain feedback from fellow scientists in order to stay motivated and keep your work growing. So drag yourself out of your laboratory or classroom or particleboard cage and meetup with other like-minded scientific citizens, right here, real soon! Whether you are just starting out or are retired now, our meetups are for you to mix and mingle with leaders and adepts in fields we pioneer. 

About the name. You may know that character who shows up in every so many cartoons, holding a flask that has just blown up in his face? Many cultures know him as "The Mad Scientist." Well, s/he is a symbol of unflappable curiosity, thirsty for discovery, and this is (minus the explosions) our mascot as well! This is also to identify us as people with a playful side who are interested in or passionate, or hog-whole crazy about science. Naturally, we care about more than just the hard sciences of Physics, Chemistry, and Biology; we do wealthily endorse this world's worth of closely related disciplines--you said it--from medicine to astronomy, engineering civilly or socially, paleoecology finds to finding chemical prospecting, for the sake of payloads of nanobots to come, and so on. And on!e

"Science is the only institution that rewards those who change the status quo." Carl Sagan taught me that. And that's what we're going to try to do! When we have to retreat in defeat, we will, and we will return redoubled with another puzzle to tackle! "Bring it up to date or leave it where it was hundreds of years ago." I said that..

With every best wish,

Donald
results.name: Mad Scientists

results.description: A women’s group in this area is hard to find for women in their 40's and over 50 so I decided to establish one. I think there are a number of women in this area, who wish to meet other women with similar interest. The purpose of this group is to allow woman to come together and establish genuine friendships by socializing and communicating with each other. As women, we can come together and be supportive by sharing our experiences, both personal and professional. Activities for this group will be local outings such as movies, dining out, jazz night out, plays, concerts and outdoor events. Other activities could be a one day trip to New York, Crab Feast across the bridge or a weekend getaway. I encourage all member to make suggestions that are appropriate for this group. Meet ups can be scheduled as often as the members wish. Normally, meet ups are held one to two times a month. Each member should become involved with the group and everyone should motivate and encourage each other. The ultimate goal is to RELAX and have plenty of FUN. In order to cover the monthly meetup fee, a small yearly fee of no more than $5 will be required and any activity cost. Is this group designed for what you have in mind? If yes, you are welcomed to join us. I am excited to meet all of you ! Your Meetup Organizer
results.name: Baltimore's Social Butterflies (40s & Over 50)

results.description:
Iranian American Academics and Professionals (IAAP), formerly known as Iranian Academic Association-DC (IAADC), aims at providing a medium for Iranian-American academics and professionals to interact and network on a local and national basis.


Presently, an important activity of IAAP is the monthly lecture series (2nd Thursday of each month) which is open to the public. The lecture series provides a platform for the local professional community to listen to Iranian scholars and professionals presenting intriguing topics related to their field of expertise.

Another important annual activity at IAAP is the offering of student scholarship awards to a limited number of full time undergraduate and graduate students studying in the universities located in the DC metropolitan area and the vicinity States. The application process and deadline are announced on our website (http://iaapdc.org)
results.name: Iranian-American Academics and Professionals, Washington DC

results.description: The area around Baltimore has quite a few fiddle players who play in smaller venues around the area. results.description: This is a social group for all of you who have traveled, or who are interested in traveling, to Morocco. We will meet regularly in person and online to exchange information, ideas and suggestions about visiting Fes, Marrakech, Essaouira and other wonderful destinations!

results.description:
Helping Carroll County, Maryland entrepreneurs connect, share and collaborate.

MISSION
The Carroll Entrepreneur Connection (CEC) is a dynamic community of entrepreneurs, seasoned business builders, and local business leaders that seek to provide people with the knowledge, tools, and support necessary to start and grow profitable and sustainable businesses in Carroll County, Maryland. By providing the infrastructure and resources for this community to connect, share and collaborate, more people will have the opportunity to realize their business dreams.

ATTENDEE GUIDELINES
Our events are open to local entrepreneurs, seasoned business builders, and business leaders who are passionate about helping one another on the journey toward starting and growing a profitable and sustainable business.
results.name: Carroll Entrepreneur Connection

results.description: The Wealth Generation Summit packs an amazing, unprecedented, and unbelievable amount of know-how for novice and experienced investors and real estate professionals alike. We thrive on the philosophy that if you want something done right, don't do it yourself! That's why we are bringing together some of the world's leading real estate experts, thinkers and doers to equip you with everything you need to successfully move forward. Amazing speakers, powerful personal connections and unforgettable moments are expected during each day of our Wealth Summit, sparking growth, innovation, and the jump start that you need to expand your mind and explode your real estate portfolio. Wealth is the only way to achieve true financial liberation. The route to financial empowerment involves four fundamentals: Creating, Managing, Protecting and Growing. Join us and create your wealth blueprint and the Wealth Generation Summit is your path to achievement.
results.name: Wealth Summit 2015 Meetup

results.description: We are a group founded by a few international students who are interested in meeting people through various sports. We do skiing, snowboarding, horseback riding, trail riding, hiking, ice-skating, shooting, archery, laser-tag, kayaking, sailing, windsurfing, surfing, and badminton. Please check our photos!
