results.description:
Energetic fasting, or Bigu (避谷), has long been a tradition for health and longevity in Taoist & Buddhist practice. There are many documented benefits from reduced calorie-intake and fasting, especially in terms of slowing down aging process, detoxifying body, cleansing digest system, and increasing energy balance. A recent research reported that fasting for 2 days could promote cell regeneration of the immune system. A national conference was hold (2000) in Penn State to explore health benefits and scientific research of Qigong Bigu with 500+ attendants. With appropriate guidance and careful monitoring, Qigong fasting can be a safe and effective way for health and healing, and for boosting outcomes of mind-body practice. http://www.scribd.com/doc/40294944/Bigu-Conference-Report... 


This training group will meet in person twice a year, 4-day each time, to teach and promote qigong fasting, and to exchange information and experiences during other time.-- Please check back for more details on each training section, and feel free to post questions or comments about fasting.


With guidance and supervision of master Faxiang Hou, Dr. Kevin Chen will teach turtle breathing, skin-breathing meditation, and a set of fasting Qigong exercises with instruction and Q&A, share the techniques on how to cleanse and purify your body, including the liver, kidney and lungs. Cleansing your body & blood of toxins helps balancing your energy! Many students joint master Hou three times a year for 16 years in this type of training & practice…. (See http://www.qigongresearchsociety.com for more details). The class and training will not only make your fasting easier and less suffering, but also share some ancient wisdoms on diet and body cleanse in daily life.
results.name: Maryland Qigong Fasting (Bigu) Training & Meetup

results.description: I created this group to see if there are others out there interested in weapons training. I've done a mix of martial arts for the last 20 years, getting instructorship in the variety of arts Tribe-K teaches. I'm not looking to start a school up here right now, and neither am I interested in joining any other school. But I would like to get some practice and share with and learn from others. This group is open to anyone wanting to learn, practice and share what they know about weapons. Training could in theory range from simple stick and knife work, to throwing knives, to firearms, depending on who wants to lead instruction. The only rule I have for this group is that you do not disparage other arts. You can think you and your system is the best, but keep it to yourself and let your actions speak louder than your words. So, Interested? Let me know, and once we get a couple people we'll find a place and start training.
results.name: Severn Weapon Skills Practice Group

topics.name: Exploring The World - Traveling and Excursions

results.description: For people with a passion for travel. Let's get together to plan our next getaway! The world is waiting for us to explore. Yes, I am a travel planner and want to share my passion of travel with others. We will meet for all of you to decide where you would like to explore next. You dream.....I do the work! So if you are ready share travel ideas and have them come true this is the group for you.
results.name: You Had Me At Vacation Meetup

results.description:
Let's get together for yoga classes in Laurel on (1) FRIDAYS from 7-8pm: Unwind and end a busy week with a restorative yoga class that involves deep stretching and an extended savasana (relaxation) and (2)SATURDAYS from 8:30-9:30am: Build strength and flexibility in a heated vinyasa flow class. Vinyasa means breath linked with movement.

Studies show that yoga offers countless mental and physical health benefits: reducing insomnia, combating depression, stress management and relaxation, improved concentration and focus, lowering blood pressure and blood sugar associated with diabetes, improved strength and flexibility, stretching tight or stiff muscles and joints and so much more.

Never done yoga before or a beginner? We absolutely WELCOME and ENCOURAGE you to attend. As long as you're breathing, you CAN do yoga. Flexibility is not required. Classes are tailored for all ages and fitness levels. Come with an OPEN mind and heart and be READY to have fun!!! 

Please wear comfortable clothing and bring a yoga mat if you have one (we have loaner mats and other props available if you don't), a towel and water.

Cost: $15 for a single drop-in session or $80 for a 10-class pack.  You may pay in-person or sign up online: http://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/ws?studioid=176...

Yoga with Tyree is located in the Laurel Lakes Executive Park in Laurel directly in front of the lake.  The studio is inside the Pierce Group Suite (the last suite on the right side of the building complex). Questions? Please call 443-574-5434 or email yogawithtyree@gmail.com. Also, please like or follow me on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram "Yoga with Tyree" for more information and updates. See you soon!
results.name: Laurel Yoga Meetup

topics.name: Restoring the US Constitution in Government

results.description: We are a blend of Conservative, Republican and Liberty Activists of all ages, races and creeds, whose aim is to bring personal freedom and responsibility to our community.  We believe in obeying the U.S. and State of Maryland Constitutions, limited government, property rights, civil rights, low taxes, low government-spending, protecting the unborn, and our 2nd Amendment Right to Bear Arms.  Freedom means exercising your rights however you like, as long as you don't interfere with another person's rights.   If you want to make sure that our elected officials are PROTECTING our rights and not trampling-upon them, you have found the right group.  Welcome Home!
results.name: Harford County Campaign for Liberty

topics.name: Grief Support for Partners and Spouses

results.description: This is a group for anyone who has lost a loved one but still wants to celebrate Valentine's Day with joy instead of grief. I am starting this group because I recently lost a friend of 31 years to colon cancer. She would want me to live on with dignity and happiness and to share my joy, pain and poetry with others. I want to spend this special Love Day with good people who have suffered loss but insist on finding beauty, light and laughter in their new lives.
results.name: Grief Relief Gathering

results.description:
The weekend of February 13-14, 2015 is the FIRST Global Divestment Day from fossil fuels (hundreds of events all around the world!)
http://gofossilfree.org
If you are concerned about the environment and convinced that oil, gas, or coal should stay in the ground where it belongs, there is a movement for you. We can make the unthinkable (independence from fossil fuel energy) happen - and faster than anyone would have thought!
With the successful strategy of divestment (against apartheid and tobacco), we can convince pension funds, universities, and any investment institution, to move its money out of fossil fuel companies and put it instead into renewable energy.
Students are at the forefront of this movement but there is so much to do in our communities. Let's get together and develop plans of action that will work for every one involved.
KICK-OFF EVENT on Friday, Feb. 13 at 5:30pm in Timonium. Please sign up!
http://act.350.org/event/gdd/10167
results.name: Baltimore Divestment from fossil fuels Meetup

results.description: This is a group of Latino women living in the Baltimore City area, who love Charm City, and have become an integral part of it. We are looking to network, socialize, share, and learn the mixture of our cultural expressions while having fun. results.description:
Black African Dance styles came to Brazil and everybody loved it. Period. WikiUp the rest!


That's me, on the left, with a Carnavalesco, down in Rio. He spends 9 months of every year sculpting Styrofoam that goes on the floats in the parades going on in heavy, heavy Samba competition. I'm made out like a "Sons of Gandhi" from Salvador de Bahia and if you knew about them. . . . Forget it. I'm going to make this MeetUp easy & awesome, or the next organizer is YOU.


That means you can listen to her. Or somebody else the DJ puts on. No dance lessons. We will be going clubbing to our own events together. I'm so White I'm blond. Have a couple drinks, have a legal toke in one of DC's fine alleys, approach me, the other guy, the other girl, you get it, and we'll dance. I like a few small dancehalls, that's it. Ya'll talk soon.


Brazil's getting older, but richer and browner, too. Fun and funny, this former housemate of mine (below), a computer programmer up in our old penthouse, is a lovely young gay dude who says it all!!


Signing off,

Your new (Interim) Organizer for now,

Donald ["Donal-GEE"]


Talk soon!
results.name: BRAZILIAN & CONGOLESE DANCING in DC

results.description:
Dear all,

We invite you to discover how to "Rest the Mind". Our method is a simple and effective way to integrate meditation into your daily routine. The method is not a belief system but offers you direct experience which you can assess for yourself. 

                                                It is a remodeled system of Raja Yoga (Yoga of the Mind) which calms the mind and brings it to a centered state, thus becoming balanced and effective. We meet twice-weekly at Natural Path Meditation Center in Ellicott City. You are warmly invited to one of our Meetups or schedule a time to learn more about us. For more information please visit www.sahajmarg.org

Warm Regards

Mahesh Iyli

maheshiyli@gmail.com

results.description:
This is a Meetup group for professional massage therapists and students who want to: 

• Share ideas 
• Get support

results.description:
The Get Up, Move, and Explore (Gum_E) the DMV meetup was created for men and women to keep each other motivated as we strive to increase our physical activity. We are not a Hiking Group, but we may hike. We are not a Walking Group, but we need to walk. We are a Moving Group, so Let’s Move.

This group will look to each other to keep motivated since it's easy to lose motivation noting this is the 2nd attempt at this successful group. Members should suggest things to do or even host events themselves. Hiking , walking, shopping, dancing,  healthy eating, trails, community center classes, joint- meetups, etc. …. the organizer is game. Everyone moves at the pace that is comfortable to them. It doesn’t matter if you are fast or slow. The slow ones will be encouraged to move as fast as the fast ones and the fast ones will be encouraged to keep striving forwarded or they might end up like the slow ones :-) If you are trying something new, you should consult your doctor 1st. Your safety is important to us and it should be to you too.

So if you’re on a journey to be more active, and don’t mind pulling people along who are losing motivation, this group is for you. Let's shout it loudly : While the organizer is a couch potato, there are fitness buffs in the group. This group just asks for you to be courteous of other people’s time planning and showing up to events by not having no-shows or last minute cancelations.

The Let’s Move Campaign isn’t the reason the group started but it was one of the driving factors. Non-Moms do the “Mom Dance” just as much

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hq-URl9F17Y

Let's stop talking or thinking about what we are going to do and let's start doing it. Now Let's Have Some Fun and feel free to give event suggestions.
results.name: Get Up, Move, and Explore the DMV-Phase II

results.description:
Travel as a visitor, not as a traditional tourist. Make friends around the world. Learn about other cultures first-hand. How can you do these things? Come to our events and meet members of the Friendship Force of the National Capital Area (Washington, DC area) and hear our stories of our adventures. As part of our club, you can meet people of other countries and cultures by staying in their homes while visiting their country, by hosting them in your home, or by simply meeting them at events we hold during their visit. We share meals, conversation and the routines of daily life, creating a unique cultural encounter and lasting friendships. When we visit or host another club, the club organizes a program of activities to introduce the visitors to the local area (for us, this can include visits to museums, the Capitol, nearby cities such as Annapolis, and more). Our Friendship Force club is affiliated with Friendship Force International, which was founded in 1977 with the mission "to promote global understanding across the barriers that separate people." There are 375 clubs in 60 countries on six continents. Most of our members live in Virginia, Maryland, the District of Columbia. We hold events throughout the metropolitan area, such as dinners or brunches in restaurants, pot-luck meals at various locations, a swim party/picnic, and more.

Find out more about our club at ffnca.org or on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/FriendshipForceNationalCapitalArea. Learn about Friendship Force International at www.friendshipforce.org.
results.name: Travel & Cultural Exchange - DC Area Friendship Force

results.description: Startup Soiree is a meetup that takes place on the last Thursday of every month; focused on creating meaningful conversations among business founders, owners and leaders within the local community. Our inspiration comes from the understanding that founders, owners and leaders must develop an accelerated understanding of the complexities that arise while building a company. Who better to help you overcome those creative hurdles than peers. Peers in Baltimore. Peers who have done it before. Peers who do it every day. Startup Soiree offers a unique opportunity to tap into a vast network of resources: mentors, advisors, partners, and friends. We are focused on developing relationships with like-minded individuals and uncovering potential areas of collaboration. Join us for local food and drink, and participate in our town-hall style conversation, specifically geared toward the opportunities and challenges of being a founder, The format of the three hour event is: 6:30-7:30pm Cocktail Hour with beer, wine, and local food 7:30-8:30pm Town Hall Style Discussion on crowd-sourced topics, moderated by a Guest of Honor 8:30-9:30pm Continued Private Conversations and Party Time! Music and cocktails! Want to come? We'd love to have you! Request an invite to Startup Soiree. www.startup-soiree.com For more Startup Soiree happenings, check us out on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook.

results.description:
Join for FREE and expand your professional network. You'll be invited to attend fabulous lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, questioning or queer (LGBTQ) professional networking social events at gay-friendly lounges in Maryland. Our members are hard-working people from a variety of disciplines such as military, government, banking, law, medicine, new media, interior or fashion design and communications. We all share the same desire to enjoy the company of like-minded professionals in a relaxed, fun atmosphere.

Our group is welcoming and inclusive, respectful of everyone under the gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, questioning or queer (LGBTQ) rainbow and straight allies. Build a stronger base of professional contacts. Share ideas and job possibilities, tap expertise, or meet potential clients or business partners. Benefit by making new connections and honing ideas. There are no membership dues to be a part of it. Nor are there referral expectations like BNI's. Just show up, meet new people, and have fun!

Founded by TJ Flavell, this group sets an exciting new paradigm. Established in 2015. it includes all gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, questioning or queer (LGBTQ) professionals and allies in Maryland. It's a new day, a new era, and this facilitates valuable connections for personal, professional, and business success.

Better yet, you may join this cosmopolitan group regardless of where you reside, be it DC, NoVA, Maryland or wherever, you are welcome. Our events are the rage! This group hosts a monthly networking social at an exciting venue in Maryland. Join today for free to stay informed about these and other upcoming events.

results.description:
The Audubon Naturalist Society seeks to create a larger and more diverse community of people in the DC region who treasure the natural world and work to preserve it. Join us for nature walks and programs at our Woodend Sanctuary in Chevy Chase, MD and further afield.  Come learn about our region's bird species at free Saturday walks for beginning birders.  Attend one of our naturalist author events.  Join one of our volunteer teams to steward our sanctuary, monitor water quality in local streams or help educate the next generation of environmental leaders.

The Audubon Naturalist Society, headquartered in Chevy Chase, is the DC region's oldest independent environmental organization. ANS inspires residents of the greater Washington, DC, region to appreciate, understand, and protect their natural environment through outdoor experiences, education, and advocacy.   Find us on the web at www.audubonnaturalist.org

results.description:
The group is currently CLOSED to new members until next season

Our new male summer share!

Are you a beach lover, do you love water and water sports do you want to enjoy this summer at the beach as much as possible?  

If you are in you are in your 30's or 40's, professional, mature, positive, young at heart, community oriented, can go with the flow, not clique-ish and don't feel entitled to disregard others, then you are perfect for this meetup.  Let's leave work and the DMV behind, hit the Bay Bridge and head to the beach every other weekend starting the weekend of May 30th.

We'll share a house, spend time basking in the sun, hit all the local beaches from Assateague to Wildwood, go jet skiing, deep sea fishing, surfing, kayaking, SUPing, play beach volleyball, bike, hike and dine out or cook out at the houses.

This is not a drinking group, this is a group for active beach lovers, that are genuinely interested in the Salt Life. This is a small group of Salt Lifers interested in spending weekends at the shore. Some may decide this is not the right time or the right group.  Sharing a house with strangers is a big commitment, you will need to make the best decision for your personal circumstances.  Our main goal is to have a stress-free harmonious summer at the beach with new friends.  You must be active to remain in the group. 

All Salt Lifers must own 4 of the following.  A bike, boat, jet ski, surfboard, paddle board, boogie board, bathing suit and/or a positive attitude. 

We have 2 houses this summer - Women on the Go-Go and our new house Salt-Lifers the male house.  If you are an active beach loving Women on the Go-Go click Here

results.description: This is a group for anyone who loves to travel both with and without their family. If you want to start traveling but are overwhelmed by the process or don't have a companion, this group is for you. Think of it as a travel accountability group. If you always travel with your kids but want to do some mom or dad getaways with like-minded people, this group is for you. We'll meet to create our travel vision board and transform our dreams into goals and our goals into actions. We'll learn tips on how to travel for less so that we can travel more often. We are not going to be pitched by travel agents but rather work on designing the best vacations that work for us and our families' needs. Later down the line, we'll also plan group getaways, trips, and learn about destinations in fun and unique ways.

results.description:
We are a twelve year old book club of women 50+ and we are  adding new members as some of our group have moved out of the area and we are now only about 10.  Meetings are held monthly in the founders home in Kensington/Silver Spring, MD every 2nd Sunday of the month from 5:00-7:00+. Everyone brings a dish and we discuss that month's book over dinner. Our group is mostly divorced women 50+ with a shared love of not only the well written word, but the arts too (theater, galleries, good movies, music, PBS) and those interested do some  of those things together as well. Some of us are also artists or crafts women doing creative projects like knitting, quilting, crocheting, beading, jewelry making, painting, etc.). However, the important thing we all have in common is our appreciation of really good literature, well written books that inspire, and our yearly picks include no "fluff". So, this is a great group for serious readers (not that some of us don't read mysteries, suspense, non fiction, etc. on the side too). 
We look forward to knowing you, however, because we meet in the founders  home, she will contact you directly  and ask you to call her so you can talk a bit first. Warm Regards.

results.description: Are you fed up with the policy gridlock, hyper-partisanship, name-calling, and ever widening political chasm in our culture? Are you longing for a better way to address society's pressing challenges? This discussion group is based on the idea that it can be possible to find common ground across the political spectrum if we can gain a better understanding of each others perspectives through face to face dialogue. People of all political stripes who are open-minded and curious are welcome. The objectives are to 1) bring together participants with diverse political views, 2) conduct a respectful and productive conversation about a difficult topic in a safe environment, and 3) explore possible areas of common ground. To promote these goals, discussions will be loosely structured around a format called “Living Room Conversations” (see http://www.livingroomconversations.org/), which has been successful in finding common ground between groups as politically disparate as the Tea Party and MoveOn.org. An inaugural meeting is planned for the evening of March 20. To join the conversation or find out more, contact Keith.Kozloff@verizon.net.
results.name: Conversations to Bridge the Political Divide

results.description: In this group we aim to reformulate and unify all knowledge, including ontological mathematics, cosmic evolution, the universal dialectic and ethics into a coherent framework. Since, by definition, existence cannot come from non-existence, an accurate understanding of reality itself requires the acceptance of an “Arche”, an eternal and fundamental basis of reality in a constant state of becoming. Aristotle postulated such reality as a conversion of potential into actuality in an all-encompassing process termed “Entelechy”. This perspective allows for a pivotal understanding of life, intelligence and the divine as evolutionary events occurring along a continuum. God is traditionally viewed as the pinnacle of intelligence, power, and complexity, but existence cannot begin with such qualities. Rather, the universe evolves in complexity over time: it was not created by God, but is God in potentia. Thus we can propose a unification of science and religion in which a creator God is a logical impossibility, but God as the end-product of cosmic evolution is logical. The Universe is converting infinite potential into maximum actualization; and we are participants in the entire process, which is perhaps the ultimate meaning of life.
results.name: Idealism Institute

I promise I am not a weird person.

Spiritual journey a little rocky? Or smooth as a walk along the beach? Either way, walking through life is easier and more interesting with others than alone. We are Spiritual Seekers of Ellicott City, and we would love for you to join our meetup. Everyone is welcome. Here are some things we do:

 ~ Quest Discussion Forum is a safe place to discuss life’s questions, such as inner peace and personal views of reality. Engage in robust conversation, or simply bring your spirit and listen. Open to anyone 18 and older.

~ Mysteries is an open environment to discuss life’s mysteries: space, the quantum world, consciousness, intuition, dreams, free will vs determinism or life’s other big unknowns. Open to anyone 18 and older.

~ Pathways is a forum for contemporary spiritual ideas based on one of today’s spiritual leaders. Share in meaningful conversation and meditation. Open to anyone 18 and older.

 ~ In Drum Circle, we share the fun of drumming. Open to all ages. Sound like you? Sign up for whatever sounds appealing and check us out. No membership or event fee.

                                                           ___________________________

Events are held at Channing Memorial Unitarian Universalist Church.  Channing is a small, lively, welcoming UU congregation in the Ellicott City area. Our mission is to: invite seekers into spiritual community, connect souls in mystery and wonder, and ignite compassion into action.
results.name: Spiritual Seekers of Ellicott City

We have a happy hour each month where we raise money for various local charities (all voluntary donations).

We will meet at least twice a month for an outing, whether for our own private dinner, speed dating, happy hours, discussions, dancing, exercising, movie nights, or church’s events. Feel free to contact me with suggestions for events you are interested in doing.

Our Objectives are to

Have fun while living life to the fullest

Meet other people who enjoy going out and having fun with other wonderful people

Learn how to be the best version of ourselves we can be

Experience and enjoy all that the DMV has to offer 

Bond with and enjoy the company of others

Empower each other with the knowledge to start and build a healthy relationship  

Meet other single people who are serious about being in a committed relationship                               

Opportunity to meet your mate

Build a solid relationship with someone where they are a friend as well as a companion


If these are your some of your objectives, we welcome you.

results.description: This is a group for musicians, their families, and friends who can get together and enjoy some great music. This group is focused toward traditional acoustic musicians who enjoy playing and learning together. All are welcome to attend even if you are just there to listen and enjoy the time with friends and family. We ask that the musicians at the jam abide by a few rules. We will only allow Traditional bluegrass instruments - Acoustic 6 String Guitar, Mandolin, Fiddle, Dobro, Upright Bass, and 5 String Banjo. Harmonicas are okay too if you can really play it! Also, acoustic bass is okay if you can't bring the upright. While all are welcome at this jam we will be playing some intermediate to advanced bluegrass. Don't let this scare you away! We are more than willing to slow it down too. This is a chance to have fun and pick together as a community, this is not a contest to see who the fastest flat picker is. This jam is set in a family environment so we ask that you please respect this and conduct yourself appropriately. The final say in what will and won't be allowed at the jam lies with the organizer. We look forward to seeing you!

results.description:
My goals for the group are to help you create portraits where the subject(s) look terrific with great lighting and posing. I will concentrate on those two areas. The kind of camera you have will not matter. I believe you can create a great portrait with the best camera around or a cell phone. 

You should  know how to work your camera. There are many other factors such as backgrounds, clothing and the message you want to convey that go into creating a portrait. Those will all be addressed as needed or in a separate class. The classes are for people who want to improve their people portraits. Anyone can pick up a camera these days and take a photo but to take a portrait to the next level requires more thought, understanding and a lot of practice.  

I'd like to see how the group evolves, but for now we'll get together on location, near Silver Spring, Bethesda and NW and learn about natural portrait posing and lighting. Sometimes we will go for an urban look and other times we might go to a park. We will look for lighting situations that mimic studio lighting without lighting equipment (except maybe a reflector). We will pose each other as singles, couples and groups and occasionally we'll have a model. Next fall I may teach studio portraits. Most of the time we'll meet on Saturday morning and be done before noon.

I look forward to sharing with you. Barbara Glaeser
results.name: Washington Portrait Posing & Lighting Meetup

results.description: Are you interested in learning more about Qigong energy healing? This group is for promoting health and wellness through an ancient practice called QiGong. What is Qigong? Qigong focuses on improving physical health and wellness. It opens the energy flow within the body by eliminating blockages. The intent is to balance the body by opening the energetic pathways (meridians). This is accomplished by a series of gentle movements synchronized with the breath. This form of Qigong can be safely practiced by the beginner, with limited movement, to the most advanced student. It benefits all students and aides them in moving forward no matter what their prior experiences. Each class is started with a set of Opening Moves to allow the body structure to open in all directions. Next, we move through the Qigong movements. These movements focus on Energy passing through specific pathways (or meridians). The class ends with a closing Qigong form that integrates the mind-body-spirit to a more grounded state of well-being. Qigong is an excellent tool to acquire mind-body-spirit awareness. Its movements provide a path toward personal transformation. Each individual may have a different experience each time they practice the form. The goal is as they work toward balance of the Yin-Yang Qi they will notice improved health, increased energy and a greater awareness of life. What are the benefits? Qigong enhances immune function, reduces the ill effects of stress, prevents disease, calms the mind and emotions, lowers blood pressure, increases flexibility, cultivates energy, treats chronic pain, and improves sleep.
results.name: Laurel Qigong Meetup

results.description:
Veterans Forever Soldiers (VFS) is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt nonprofit organization with a mission to Honor, Respect, and Care for United States Military Veterans. We have created this wholistic-focused veterans interest group to build a support network of veterans and veteran spouses who are passionate, motivated and energized to mastermind and act in loving support to veterans. This is a space for those who are ready to make a serious impact in, thereby changing, the way service is delivered in the veteran community. Veterans - our very own families and friends - are grieving, homeless, hungry, traumatized. Together we will wholistically 1) mastermind/have open table-top discussions on the issues so that we can create/develop activities such as workshops, food programs, presenting at various venues, fund raise, item raise, item distribution, outdoor sport and other events;  and 2) act - implement and carry forward these activities.

VETers may be interested in helping to strengthen the organization by joining the Board of Directors, Advisory Board or other committee. Any funds raised are tax deductible to the donor and 100% benefit to VFS. VETers will meet once per month for starters. Let's get together in continuation of service.

Visit our website here http://veteransforeversoldiers.org/

results.description: The Sonatype Nexus Community Meetup is a place where you can meet other Nexus users, exchange ideas on how to use Nexus, hear real-world stories of Nexus practitioners and get the inside scoop on what is on the near term roadmap for the next version of Nexus.

results.description:
Private round table group sponsored by TEDCO for Ed Tech Executives.  

PLEASE NOTE:  This group is limited to executives invited by TEDCO.  For more information on TEDCO and the services they provide, please visit: http://tedco.md/
results.name: TEDCO Ed Tech Roundtable

results.description: This a group coming together to inspire, instruct and support those who want to be powerful, purposeful and profitable in both their business and personal lives. We are comprised of business beginners, movers, shakers and innovators. It will be our cumulative experience, desires, resources, and intentions that empower us to be better and more powerful as a result of actively participating in the building of this group. Get excited... Life is about to get bigger, better and more fulfilling. Lets Go!
results.name: DMV Small Business Owners and Start Ups Meetup

results.description:
We meet at various locations in Baltimore and surrounding areas in Maryland for plein air painting. 

This is a great way to meet other artists and get OPTIONAL feed back on your work from the group. Paint for about 2 1/2 hours, break for lunch, go back to painting if desired or call it a day. We will have a location and meet up times, but, of course, you can start and end whenever you want. Artist's are responsible for bringing their own art supplies, lunches, snack, drinks, suntan lotion,  etc...

*For most locations we will have to walk from  where our cars are parked to a painting location.  I use a rolling cart to carry my art supplies, but a backpack also works. 

*A $4.00  yearly donation would to help  pay the website organization's yearly fees. Thank you!
results.name: Baltimore/Maryland  Plein Air Painters Meetup

results.description:
Bringing people with a variety of ideologies and perspectives together for friendly, polite discussion of global, international, national and local trends, events and politics.

We encourage people to give their honest opinions, given that they are able to substantiate them.  Many topics may not be politically-correct, but anyone with a sincere interest in current events, history, geopolitics or philosophy should join*!


*Read:  If you genuinely plan to attend our meetups.  Members will be removed after 3 months inactivity.
results.name: World Affairs, Trends and Politics!

results.description: This meetup is for developers and designers who work frequently with text-based formats, and are looking to improve their skills, particularly using the Vim editor, though other editor aficionados are welcome to join During our Meetups, we will have between 30-50 minutes of talks, with the remainder of the initial hour dedicated to open forum discussion, allowing users to pose questions or relate problems they've encountered. We will follow this with a social hour at a nearby restaurant for anyone who's interested!
results.name: Baltimore Vim

results.description:
We are a fun loving group in our 30’s & 40’s , that enjoy socializing and attending a wide variety of activities.

• We do require your Minimum FIRST NAME and First Initial of Last Name a recognizable PHOTO of your face to join the group.

• We accept 30s to 50.

• We are a social group of friends, NOT A DATING SITE.

• Our Activities include happy hours, festivals, outdoor activities, dance parties, charity events.

• TO JOIN OUR GROUP, in addition to telling us a little about yourself, please let us know if you have attended any of our events or already know anyone in our group.

• All Meetup members of the Bel Air/White Marsh within all three groups will pay for only one member annual dues of $10 upfront. Please forward your dues using PayPal via belairwhitemarshmeetup@gmail.com 

If you do not fulfill the above requirements, you will be DENIED Membership!

Being a Social Group Any Inappropriate Behavior of Any Kind will be Dealt with Swiftly & Membership shall be Curtailed with Deletion from ALL OF OUR 3 GROUPS
results.name: Bel Air/White Marsh 30's & 40's Social Meetup Group

results.description:
This group is a "clone group" of our main meetup page which is simply called "The Firefly House". The purpose of this is to draw membership from the Maryland area, as we sometimes have events there as well as in DC.

____________________________
We are a tradition of Witchcraft based in the DC/NOVA/MD area. Our meetup is the container for what we call the "outer circle" of participants and members. We are facilitated by a governing coven called Coven of the Spiral Moon, the "inner circle." We put on public rituals for many of the sabbats as well as a number of classes on various Wiccan and Witchcraft-related topics. We are also a Wiccan tradition that people can participate in casually, or through the deeper path of initiation into the outer circle or one of our two coven's. All respectful individuals are welcome to engage in this Great Work of evolving our souls, growing in power, and becoming attuned with this holy Earth.
results.name: The Firefly House (Maryland-Area Members)

topics.name: Trans/Gender Queer, queer and queer friendly peeps

results.description:
Bi, pan, fluid, queer cis ladies/trans ladies/femmes of color: Have you walked into an event for "us" and felt so highly underrepresented that you wanted to Beyonce blend into the proverbial elevator wall? Are you tired of being judged in queer spaces the moment people find out you're bi/pan?  <br>

 If you're looking to do things like network, laugh, share stories, bond, have meaningful dialogue, make lasting friendships, socialize, and/or have fun with kick ass people in a safe space, this group is for you! Please, only awesome people need apply. (And if you looked at this page, that's probably you. So, join!) <br>
results.name: DC Bisexual Women Of Color Collaborative

results.description:
A drum circle is a fun experience that is accessible to anyone who wants to participate regardless of age or experience level. The goal is to achieve oneness with a group, not rhythmic perfection. Shamanism is the oldest spiritual belief system on earth. Drumming has been a method of group healing and achieving unity since the beginning of time. Studies have shown that drumming accelerates physical healing, boosts the immune system and produces feelings of well-being.

The drum circle will be held every 2nd Saturday of the month from 7:00 to 8:30 with time for socializing afterwards.
results.name: Shamanic Drumming Circle of Timonium

results.description: The Skeptical Advocacy Society is a new group founded to take action for evidence based practices and against pseudoscience and quackery in our communities. We’ll get the word out about anti-vaccine lies, protest psychics who prey upon the bereaved, and give skeptics a presence at the next “natural” medicine faire. Ready to do the hard work of skepticism? Join us!
results.name: Skeptical Advocacy Society

results.description: This is the group of Apache NiFi users in the MD, DC, VA area. Apache NiFi is an easy to use, powerful, and reliable system to process and distribute data.  In late 2014 it was open sourced to the Apache Software Foundation and it graduated to a top level project in July 2015.  This meetup provides an opportunity to discuss Apache NiFi, where it is at, where it is going, and to help grow the community of both users and developers interested in the technology and problem domain.
results.name: Apache NiFi Users Group - DC VA MD

results.description:
The first Tuesday of each month at Serendipity Jazz Coffeehouse (Brookland, DC) we get to the heart of sexual and emotional health. So many relationship experiences we want to examine and understand at the same time we need information and understanding from a Sex Geek (M.Ed in Human Sexuality) not just someone who offers popular advice without empirical data. As the host and sex health educator, I ensure you'll meet great people, industry experts and fellow Sexologist that work throughout Washington DC. You have the opportunity to learn to understand sexuality from a diverse lens, participate in fun activities, have a groovy drink or two and have an experience you can grow with!

Libido Talk serves as a platform for professional people to unwind, be unprofessional and uncensored, while discussing what they truly feel (in a loving kind-of-way). Pretend you didn't have a long day, pretend that one drink called the g-spot (our house special for $6.00) will rinse down the day.  Perhaps it will, who knows.  Unite in understanding relationships single, partnered or alternative. Although it serves multiple functions, its main focus is to create healthy and informative dialogues about sexuality in our audience. Fostering healthier relationships will benefit us all personally in every aspect of our life.

What to Expect?

You will alway be welcomed with a big smile and HH drink and food specials as soon as you hit the door.  Grab a seat, socialize with the friends we hope you bring or the new friends you meet inside. After a quick intro we always kick off with a fun activity.  They are simple activities that loosen us up and get the ideas flowing about our monthly topic. Each month we have special invited guest who are Experts in their field and Sexologist from different sexological backgrounds. We chat, have questions and entertaining dialogue about our topic.  The topic last for no more than a hour so you can make it home and have a restful night.

What's Next?

Libido Talk is geared towards building the community we all envision. That community includes: couples, singles, parents, kinksters, LGBTQ'ers, pansexuals, eroticist and more.  You are never too young or too old for these conversations and revelations. We are growing.  We want to grow communities of sexually educated people so we change the face of STI/STD prevalence, increase healthy consenting relationships, and model healthy sexual pride and integrity for young people. We are a growing brand and look to build our audience in larger forums.  Your attendance helps us grow, helps us inform, and helps us build a sex-positive community for all.

PS. Don't forget to check out our sponsors, we are building, so take advantage of cool discounts.
results.name: DC: Libido Talk presents: HH/Sex Chats/and more, more, more!

topics.name: CCNA CCNP CCDA CCDP CCVP CCSP CCIP CCIE CCDE

results.description:
Today, 40% of the world population has internet connectivity. In 1995, less than 1% of the world had internet connectivity. To support the IT infrastructure of the future, we will need bright, well versed cyber-security and networking gurus who have the passion and drive to continue in the never ending quest for knowledge and enlightenment; the individual who is excited about the technologies and how they work. Charm City Net Tech's goal is to bring together Technology enthusiasts alike in Baltimore into one space, engaging them in a series of labs, study sessions, as well as presentations. 

 We want to learn from each others experiences, and we want to cultivate learning along side each other. Meetup Members, feel free to reach out to me if you wish to speak about a certain topic! 


 Adam Bouhmad - Founder/Organizer
CCNA
results.name: Charm City Net Tech

results.description:
Hola! We are a group of Spanish speakers who like to get together to chat en español. This group provides an opportunity to practice your Spanish to improve as you learn or maintain your fluency. All levels are welcome, but we will focus on conversation with minimal English--so the target group is advanced beginner/low intermediate through advanced and native speakers. Vamos a hablar!
Find us on facebook at: Amigos Hablando Español
results.name: Baltimore Metro Spanish Language Meetup

results.description: If you're interested in getting the word out about Donna Edwards, a progressive Congresswoman running to be the first black woman in the Senate since 1996, get on board. We'll meet to talk about what she stands for, her strengths, how she's different from Van Hollen and how we can tell people about her. We've got one year to get this done!
results.name: Grassroots for Donna - Baltimore

topics.name: Tabletop Role Playing and Board Games

results.description:
5th Ed. Dungeons & Dragons experienced DM looking for players. Home brew world, and original campaign. Strong mix of Roleplaying and combat. Weekly game Saturday night, Located near Rosedale MD.

<br>

There has always been only one story, the oldest...

<br>

In a northern Provence of the kingdom of Eldanath there has been an earthquake. Baron Arnel Vorn has sent riders north to the remote town of Northkeep to ascertain damage and the welfare of Northkeep's citizens. No word has returned. A troop of guardsmen followed and has also disappeared. What has befallen Northkeep and those sent to help? A group of adventurers is about to find out...
results.name: Baltimore County Dungeons & Dragons

results.description: This is a group for people interested in fitness, tennis, and meeting new people. All skill levels welcome! Never played before but interested in learning? Please join us. Do you play frequently and want to a new challenge? Bring it! See you on the courts.
results.name: East Baltimore Social Tennis Meetup

results.description: Sport bike riders who like to tour.  Riding safely.  Long day rides,  long weekend rides,  distance riding on sport bikes.  Packing and preparing for long rides.  Riding techniques for safe back road riding.  Managing risk.  Maintaining our machines.  Having safe fun while travelling.
results.name: MID-ATLANTIC SPORT TOURING (MAST)

topics.name: Basics of metalsmithing for jewelry making

results.description: This is a group for people just learning metalsmithing techniques and would like to acquire a space to develop those techniques. I live in Hyattsville near University Avenue and as you know significant change is coming with the Purple Line. I think there is a great opportunity here to carve out a space for developing artists who are not in a position to commit to renting a studio space full-time. Hopefully, this group can come together and acquire a large studio space that nurtures interest in this ancient art. Maybe this can segue into developing an artspace for other crafts like spinning, ceramics, glassmaking, etc.
results.name: Hyattsville Project - Metalsmithing Meetup

results.description:
AAEW is a professional non-profit organization focused on empowering women to reach their fullest potential.  We do not just focus on professional development, AAEW believes that success lies in a thriving personal and professional life.  Through professional development, resources, personal support and collaboration, we empower women to confidently achieve their dreams and become leaders in their communities. 

We provide invaluable resources, guidance, accessible tools, and empowerment that will take women to the next level in their personal and professional lives.

Inspire : We bring together a high caliber of women who desire to share their knowledge, experience and support. to promote personal growth and positive connections.  Our goal is to inspire those who have a strong desire to move to the next level in their lives.

Growth: Through relationship building, collaboration and sharing, we promote growth and challenge that will build confidence and success.

Connections: We strive to bring together a strong force of women with big hearts, open minds and similarity so that an unbreakable link can be established.

American Association of Empowered Women, Inc.

www.aaoew.org

 

JOIN TODAY!
results.name: American Association of Empowered Women, Inc.

results.description: Celebrating the rich intercultural diversity, the Around the World Cultural Food Festival invites you to join us for our Annual event Saturday, June 18, 2016 from 11:00AM – 6:00PM on the National Mall, Washington D.C. This event is free, with plenty of food and crafts available for purchase.
results.name: Around the World Cultural Food Festival

results.description: This group is for anyone interested in creating an intentional sustainable homestead.  Its for people who value a healthy lifestyle, peace, low stress, harmony.  We can all work together cooperatively towards creating our homestead by growing food; including fruit trees, greens and other vegetables, herbs, berries, grapes, etc...  We can learn to live harmoniously together by implementing NVC (Non Violent Communication) and other effective and beneficial tools for communicating and relating in a healthy respectful way.  We can build our Eco structures on the land so there's no mortgage.  We can use compost toilets.  We can work from home to make incomes and live close to nature.  We can raise our children together so there's less overwhelm.  I started this meeting because I'm looking for other people to do this with .. To create community,, to support actualizing our ideas and visions
results.name: Sustainable Community Building

results.description: The MargaReaders is a fun book club that meets over a drink or dinner. We will mainly read Pop Fiction books and casually discuss the books. While we primarily are a book club, we will schedule events for a variety of purposes, including chick-flicks, brunches, happy hours, and whatever else we think of. We just like to get together and have fun.
results.name: The MargaReaders

results.description: A group for women of all colors and creeds who juggle their marriage, kids and career. Not a sole support group but an outlet for like minded women who care to meet those with similar responsibilities.
results.name: Married Working Mommies

results.description:
NOTE:

• There is no charge to join this group.

• This group is not for travel agents.

• There will be no promoting services.

• Please contact admin for that,

• This group is based in MD/DMV area but we accept from all areas.

thank you


This group is for women who are solo travelers ages 30 & over but hate traveling alone, sometimes.

We will indulge in weekend getaways, and traveling across the world-inexpensively, of course. We will only promote positivity.

Not only will we share the common goal of getting our passports stamped to capacity but we will also explore the opportunities to bond, make new friends, and network. Everyone is encouraged to give ideas for vacations, and events. all travel arrangements will be handled by group admin.

All members must

• attend a meet & greet within 3 months of joining

• have a photo in your profile.

•  be open minded, and ready to have fun


Please, no promoting services. Please always feel free to contact me via email with questions and concerns.

Cattiness, drama and ugly attitudes are not acceptable.
results.name: Divas with Passports

results.description:
Want to see great documentary films . . . followed by discussion . . . free of charge . . . every month? We believe this is the only documentary film series in Baltimore that is open to the public and free of charge. (We appreciate and encourage donations, but they're optional). 

We purchased a license from the Motion Picture Licensing Corporation.

Always on the fourth Wednesday of the month at 6:30 pm in downtown Baltimore. You can see the upcoming films here: http://http://baltimoreethicalsociety.org/programs-activities/film-series/

The current batch of upcoming films are all all academy award nominees - or winners.  After the viewing, we'll have a discussion, usually with a local expert or advocate on the particular topic to lead the discussion.

The series is hosted by the Baltimore Ethical Society in a beautiful viewing space, with free street parking.  Refreshments (beverages and snacks) are free, and other food is available for purchase. We'll take food orders (delivery pizza, etc?).  We can eat while we watch.  So bring a couple of bucks in case you get hungry.

We'll also use this site to announce a separate discussion series, without films, on Sunday mornings at 10:30 am in the same location. Also with food, and also free of charge.   These are presentations by local experts or advocates on a topicial issue, followed by Q & A.  These Sunday presentations are preceded by an introduction and brief announcements by the Baltimore Ethical Society, and followed by Q & A, then time to mingle, to enjoy snacks, and to speak with the presenter.
results.name: Charm City Film Series

results.description: "Toddlerz N Tweenz and all ages N between is a community of parents and children who gather for social outings across the DMV. The target age group is 2-12 yrs. and the fun is limitless. Some of our activities will consists of skating, movies debut, theme parties, and so much more"These outings and events are thoughtfully designed to foster relationships while having fun. Relationships that will last a life time.
results.name: Toddlerz N Tweenz

topics.name: A new way of doing business in the community

results.description: Meet with small business owners and self employed individuals. Discuss changes to operating our businesses and new opportunities. Share business leads and options. Exchange ideas.
results.name: Small Business Networking

results.description: This is a group for anyone who is interested in investing in real estate in Maryland. We invite new and experienced investors. I started this group because I have been a real estate broker who specializes in Bank owned properties and have dealt with many investors over the last 32 years. I am a very experienced real estate broker and investor. I am looking for others to join our meetup so they can find the best investment properties in the market. These properties might be currently on the market or properties that no one else knows about. I look forward to sharing my experience with everyone.
results.name: Baltimore Real Estate Investors Meetup

results.description:
We are a group of Christian men and women who believe they have an end-time calling, and who are committed to being equipped, edified and empowered to fulfill it.  We are excited about walking in identity and authority as Ambassadors for Christ, preparing the Way of the Lord!  Christ is coming back for His Church - a Church without spot or wrinkle.  Therefore, The Bride must make Herself ready!  We have work to do!  The Kingdom of Heaven is at hand.  The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few!  It's time to prepare the way of the Lord!

Who Should Join?  Men and women in ministry who ready to respond to the call of God on their lives. These are leaders in any capacity:  Sunday school teachers, ministry leaders, aspiring leaders, teachers, evangelists, altar workers, worship leaders, etc.  We are also giving special focus to those who serve full or part-time on staff at a Church or faith-based organization.  

Why Should You Join?

https://youtu.be/L8NX_ovuJVc


                      Our Mission is to raise up 1,000,000 Way Makers all over the world!  


Our study and discussion centers on the book entitled "The Way Makers - Ambassadors for Christ, Preparing the Way of the Lord" by Min. Angela M. Gracey, PHR. We meet bi-weekly on Saturdays from 10:00am to 12 noon, starting June 6, 2015, at the new Panera Bread, 14806 Baltimore Avenue in Laurel, MD. We are also committed to empowering, equipping and coaching aspiring authors to develop their creative gift and to give birth to the vision within them.   

This is what one of our pioneer leaders had to say:

https://youtu.be/0VrCrlmoZu4

We encourage all prospective members to come prepared to fully participate and commit to the process of growth and development as a Christian leader. If you are serious about the call of God on your life, we want to extend a warm invitation to join us! Jesus is coming back for a Church without spot or wrinkle. The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few! It's time to repent! The Kingdom of Heaven is at hand. We are The Way Makers - Ambassadors for Christ! Preparing the Way of the Lord!
results.name: The Way Makers Book Club Meetup

topics.name: Getting Started as a Real Estate Investor

results.description:
REAL WORLD LOCAL CONTENT TO HELP YOU GROW AS A REAL ESTATE INVESTOR IN VA, DC, & MD!

Over 1500 DC Metro Real Estate Investors and growing! Go to www.cazainvestornetwork.com to get access to our past meetups + training.

Monthly Format:

1) Introduction: 15 minutes
2) Training Q&A: 50 minutes
3) Deals/Networking/Fun: 30 minutes

Welcome to the largest real estate investment network in the DC Metro area. Each month we discuss a topic at length which will help you grow as a real estate investor.

Jan: Getting Started: Why Wholesaling Is Your Foundation & How To Do It Effectively

Feb: How To Market For Deals

Mar: How To Estimate Renovations

April: How To Negotiate The Deal

May: Where To Find The Money

June: Rehabbing For Big Profit!

July: Building Your Investment Dream Team

Aug: Cash Flow - Buy and Hold: The Key to Wealth

Sept: How To Manage Properties Effectively

Oct: Lease Options/Subject To:

Nov: Building Your Investor Partner/Private Money Team/Be the Bank

Dec: HOLIDAY PARTY - CAZA MVP Award

I look forward to seeing you all there, let's make it a great year!

PS: Go to www.cazainvestornetwork.com to get access to our past meetups & more training.

Join the #1 Real Estate Investment Group in Virginia, DC and Maryland.
results.name: CAZA Real Estate Investor Network (Baltimore, MD)

results.description: This is a group for women who are 45+, home during weekdays, and who want to carve out some time to exercise and socialize together (lunch, movies, plays, shopping, etc.). We can also explore activities (i.e. dance, kickboxing, Tae Kwon Do, cycling, tennis, painting class, etc.) - anything that looks like fun! This group is for real women looking to establish authentic friendships. We'll share adventures, have fun together, learn from each other and help one another as we aspire to become better versions of ourselves - all while creating lifelong friendships.
results.name: Ellicott City Women's Meetup (45+)

topics.name: Quilting for Beginners and Experianced Persons
Sewing for the Love of it
Machine or hand piecing and quilting

results.description:
Hi There!

We are a group of lively, fun, friendly, kind and talented people. Please join us!

We have exciting news!  Being a member of Goodstitches, YOU are now part of a HUGE network of needle artist spanning the GLOBE!

Goodstitches.com

What does that mean? 

In early February we started working on Goodstitches. We have opened up 270+ Meetup groups in 7 countries!  We have Meetups in the USA, Canada, Australia, England, Wales, Ireland and Scotland!  Needle artists from all over the globe have joined Goodstitches before we have even had our FIRST event!  That is what we were hoping for!

We know that YOU want ACTIVE groups in your local area.  We know that you want to meet people in your area for friendship and to work and learn together.  We are making that possible!

Want to be a local host of your group or an event organizer of your local group?  WE want you!  Leaders of local groups are needed and we are providing ALL the tools-videos, pictures, forms and online training to help you make your local group successful!

Goodstitches.com

What is the purpose of Goodstitches? It is a way that people in the quilting, sewing and needle art community can connect. By being a part of this group, you are going to be able to find others and share knowledge, ask questions, find supplies, post your pictures on the meetup site and much more!

You will also be able to sell your used quilting machine, sewing machine, parts of your stash or tools that you no longer need. 

You will be able find or post a job in the needle arts!  If you are an employer, you will be able to reach needle artists in your area to fill an open job.  If you are a member looking for a job, you will be able to shop open jobs or post your resume.  ONLY people of the needle arts industry will be participating so you will be able to target your search more directly. 

You will also be able to post your business on THE STITCHERS BIZ!  No matter what area of the needle arts you work in, now you will be able to post WITH pictures and videos!  People will find a way to check YOUR postings Facebook, Pinterest, Tumbler and such!  They will also have a DIRECT way to contact you to hire you to do your work. 

If you are a manufacturer or business, you will be able to put your work out for bid or find someone who can finish a difficult project that you are unable to complete. 

Goodstitches will be working with sponsors that you know and getting good deals for you, the members of Goodstitches. Be it batting, thread, rulers, needles, yarn and embroidery threads...anything that you need to work on your craft, we are doing deals with the manufactures so that we can pass on the GREAT deals to YOU the members of Goodstitches.

We look forward to meeting you in person and getting to know you!

The Goodstitches Team

For any questions, comments, ideas, advertising, or opening a group near you please contact:

Fena D'Ottavio  FenaBiz@gmail.com

Connect With Us! 

Facebook

Twitter

Tumblr

Instagram

Youtube

Pinterest
results.name: Goodstitches Columbia, MD

results.description: Do you have a home based business in Adams Morgan? Do you want to start-up a home based business and are interested in learning from others who’ve done that successfully? Or do you work from Tryst/Starbucks/Crumbs and Coffee or Potter's House and wonder who else there might be based in Adams Morgan too? If you are interested in networking with other home based businesses in Adams Morgan, the networking group will meet again for lunch on the first Friday of every month from 12:30 to 2 pm at The Diner, 2453 18th Street, NW, Washington, DC 20009. No need to RSVP, just show up. For planning purposes salads run $6.99 to 12.99 and sandwiches are $5.45 to $11.99 so lunch should not cost you more than about $15.00. Hope to see many folks there.
results.name: Adams Morgan Working from Home Networking Meetup

results.description: Monday nights from 8:00-9:30 we will have a pick-up basketball game at the Odenton Sports Center. Our goal is to get is 15 RSVPs! this will allow to have 3 teams (2 on the court an the other one resting), after the game is over the losing team goes to rest unless the winning team has won 2 consecutive games, in which case they go to rest. This will keep a good rotation. Invite a friend/guest and have them join the group if possible. All skill levels are welcome. Note: We will continue the event if we get 10 RSVPs. If not, the organizer will cancel the event 30 minutes prior to start. Please RSVP to encourage others if you have any intention of attending. Bring $5
results.name: Odenton Basketball Meetup

results.description: Hello. I'm starting this meetup group to exchange philosophy and ideas that will facilitate unity of all races and beliefs. Ultimately this group is for anyone interested in learning proven strategies for improving their relationships, whether they be business/professional or personal/romantic. I encourage anyone interested to remember this group is about sharing ideas, not forcing them. Please come to these meetings with an open ear. Sharing the opportunity to speak and listen with others, will allow you the chance to learn from their experiences.
results.name: Non-violent Communication and Empathy

results.description:
"Behind every successful woman should be a tribe of women who have her back."
Hello lovely ladies. Are you a single black woman, that has realized that everyone around you has kids and/or married and you feel left out? You often find yourself the only one at events with no kids and husband, maybe a boyfriend. It's fun chilling and spending time with our boyfriends, but every woman needs good girlfriends too. Men don't always want to do what we want to do. Do you often find yourself not having many girlfriends or female relatives to hang out with any more because they have relocated, gotten married, have mommy duties or have a certain time to be home. Do you sometimes find yourself sitting at home on a beautiful sunny day with no girlfriends to chill with. Or on a weekend night watching Lifetime, LMN or Bravo? Do you just want to be spontaneous sometimes and just call and say let's go out or do something fun? This group is for heterosexual, Christian,  professional, classy, intelligent, positive and drama-free and like-minded women that are seeking to socialize and build true lasting friendships that will develop into a sisterhood. This will be a small group to foster a close knit and engaging atmosphere. The group will consist of women that are supportive, encouraging, inspirational and uplifting to one another. Let's engage in some awesome activities, while developing bonds and making memories that will last a lifetime. Some of the activities include: dining, brunch, lounges, cruises, festivals, concerts, plays, broadway musicals, live bands, weekend getaways, movies, spas, picnics and day trips. Having children or getting married doesn't define you, they enhance your life. We never know what God has in store for us. Until then, let's live our lives and enjoy us until we do get married and become moms. If you are interested in meeting other wonderful, like-minded ladies to explore the DMV and so much more, please join this group. I understand that sometimes you won't be able to attend every outing, but please be an active participant to make this group a success. This is not just a meetup but friendship group. Constant no shows will lead to the member being deleted from the group. Currently this group is closed to new members.
results.name: Laurel Sisterhood Meetup Ages 30-40 (Single/Without Kids)

results.description:
We are a social running group that welcomes people of all paces. 

While Baltimore is known for its rats that scurry underneath, we scurry over Roads And Trails --we are the Baltimore RAT Runners. It seems many of our runners are new to town, so if "B'more" and "Hon" are new to you, you should feel right at home with us.

Our Monday runs start at 6:45 p.m. next to the Under Armour store on S. President St. (we are not associated with UA). We have options for 3-6 miles depending on your level. 

Here are some of our runs: 
Patterson Park:http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/911470207  
Four Mile Out and Back through Fells Point: 
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/911459085 
Lake Roland Park: 
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/911501951 
Inner Harbor: 
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/911510093 
Federal Hill: 
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/911534733

Also, if you drive and find parking difficult, try the 1200 block of Bank Street for free street parking.  Also, the Little Italy Garage is inexpensive and safe.  It's between Central, Exeter, and Bank streets. 

Whether you live in Baltimore or are visiting, feel free to join us. 

Dan
results.name: Baltimore RAT Runners

results.description:
This group is for those who are interested in accelerated spiritual advancement and deeper understanding of how we can release or overcome boundaries we have placed on ourselves. Through the use of healing energy we can raise our vibration and improve our quality of health, wealth and happiness.

I AM a Reiki Master and Holistic Practitioner, Consultant and Facilitator who provides multiple forms/modalities of energetic healing including Usui, Tibetan and Kundalini Reiki, Pranic Healing, Shamanism, Crystal therapy, Sound therapy, Violet Flame, Tantra, meditation/mindfulness and Chakra/Aura clearing and balancing. I integrate all my modalities into a healing session if requested and incorporate spiritual life coaching.

I have been facilitating group sessions for 3 years. These group meditations, classes and workshops are on a variety of spiritual and metaphysical subjects. These have included teachings on the Violet Flame, different aspects of the energy body, the I AM Presence, the Christ Consciousness, 5th Dimensional Chakras, Healing, Past Life Vows, Soul Contracts, Soul mates, law of attraction, law of karma, overcoming limiting beliefs, releasing emotional trauma, crystals, sound healing, Shamanism, drum circles, Tantra, conscious languaging, releasing fear, Ascended Masters, Arch Angels/Angels and more. I also give Reiki attunements for Usui levels 1,2 & Master, Tibetan Master and Kundalini Master, offer private tantra sessions, do Reiki parties, give Corporate presentations on Reiki and wellness, work with organizations for wellness events and vend at holistic events.
results.name: Pure Energy
